It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Effective Spend is looking for a data analyst with experience in digital marketing analytics. The Digital Marketing Data Analyst works hand in hand with our PPC and SEO departments to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of our client services teams. The Data Analyst helps to clearly quantify performance objectives by maintaining our existing reporting suites, creating new methods of reporting, and automating repetitive tasks.
The Marketing Data Analyst will join our Business Intelligence team - a team that re-imagined our data analytics from the ground up. We started with web tracking and attribution (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager), then moved into reporting automation (SQL and Power BI) and are now driving a shift from descriptive reporting to actionable and insightful dashboarding. Our team is also frontline in detecting anomalies in key performance metrics that alert account managers for intervention. These initiatives directly impact almost every aspect of our company and are critical to driving our continued growth.
We are looking for a highly motivated individual that is excited by new opportunities and the potential to have a large impact. Ideal candidates will be detail-oriented, organized, and professional with the desire to take ownership of multiple projects simultaneously.
Key Responsibilities:
Report Creation – Work with account teams to create custom reports for high value clients that focus on their unique KPIs and reporting needs. Use experience with the above to drive the next generation of insightful and actionable dashboards for all clients in Microsoft Power BI, Excel, and Google Sheets.
Reporting Automation – Use existing web-based tools to query data from our sources (Adwords, Facebook, Bing, LinkedIn, etc.) and assist in developing new tools for pulling data from other sources (LinkedIn web scraping, CRMs, etc). Automate reports using Power BI, SQL, and formulas & pivot tables in Google Sheets.
Process Improvement – Identify weaknesses in existing processes and implement corrective actions. This includes streamlining our project management process, documenting around account team FAQs, and cleaning up our BI internal documentation.
Marketing Data – Dig into the data presented in platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads and understand what is happening with performance. Understand metrics like impressions, clicks, CTR, conversions, CVR, ROAS, Click-through vs. View-through, attribution windows and modes, path to conversion, A/B testing, etc.
Qualifications & Skill Requirements:
4-year Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, MIS, analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field.
1+ years of experience utilizing tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Experience with SQL is also a plus.
1+ years of experience in marketing-related analytics.
Experience with PPC, SEM or SEO marketing analytics is a strong plus.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced knowledge of Excel formulas, Pivot Tables and Macros.
Proficiency in Google Analytics.
Excellent mathematical, problem solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Experience with HTML/Javascript/CSS is a plus.
Experience with a programming language such as Python or Java is a plus.
BENEFITS
Effective Spend is proud to be named a Top 10 Best Places to Work by the Austin Business Journal. Here are some of the ways we support an awesome company culture:
Competitive paid time off
Additional volunteer PTO
Medical, dental and vision healthcare plans
401k with company matching
Bonuses for employee and client referrals
When we’re back in the office:
Fun team outings and social sports like soccer, cornhole and kickball
Foosball, chess, and other games in the office for a quick break
Great office location within walking distance of the hike and bike trail and numerous coffee shops and lunch spots
Snacks, fresh fruit, drinks and plenty of fresh-ground coffee
HOW TO APPLY
Please send your resume and a cover letter explaining your interest and related qualifications. Your cover letter is your opportunity to show off your writing skills, highlight your relevant experience and prove your attention to detail. So, show us what you’ve got!

Podium is a suite of messaging tools for local business. Using our platform, businesses of all sizes can connect with customers via text to do things like request payments, collect reviews, and sell products, in a modern, convenient way. Our work streamlining this process for local businesses has awarded us recognition on top industry lists, such as Forbes' Next Billion Dollar Startups, Forbes' Cloud 100, the Inc. 5000 (#13), and Fast Company's World's Most Innovative Companies — in the last year alone. For more about our product, watch this video.

Podium has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture and was recently named one of Inc. Magazine's Best Workplaces for 2019. We look for people who are curious, creative and work to be a little better every day. In our work together we embody our values: Be a founder, Murder drama, and Enjoy the ride.

As a data analyst at Podium, you will be a critical part of illustrating ROI to clients, and keeping those clients loyal to Podium. You will work with clients and analyze and recommend strategic, data-driven decisions to clients and build reports based on the strategy. You will be on email threads and phone calls with clients, talking through their reporting needs and proposing solutions. You will also help train these clients on the custom reports that you build.

If you are someone who is passionate about building a business, turns curiosity into valuable deliverables, can creatively solve problems using quantitative metrics, and thrives in a fast-paced, open environment, then this is the right role for you!

What you will be doing:
Build reporting dashboards for Podium's clients, providing insights into their messaging behaviors, public online reviews, and private internal feedback.
Present reporting dashboards to clients, and train them on all aspects of the reporting.
Create new ways to visualize data for our clients, and build those new reports in a scalable manner
Become an expert on all data infrastructure and Podium's products, and know how to quickly answer any question that crosses your plate
Partner and collaborate with all other teams at Podium (sales, engineering, product, marketing, etc.) to design and build internal dashboards
Foster relationships with our Strategic account managers, and make recommendations on how to best handle their accounts (identify at-risk clients, provide ad-hoc charts for slide deck presentations, etc.)
What you should have:
Minimum of coursework providing exposure to SQL with 1+ years of experience with SQL preferred
Scripting language experience (R preferred)
An understanding of common statistical applications and methods (correlation, summary statistics, regression)
The ability to clearly and effectively communicate the results of complex analyses
Experience managing multiple, simultaneous projects, and do so with minimal guidance
A passion for identifying and understanding stories in data, and an innate curiosity to find more stories
Experience with Domo/Tableau/PowerBI preferred
BENEFITS
Transparent culture
Flexibility to work in this building in Lehi, UT
Great opportunities for career growth
401k with a competitive matching contribution plan
Unlimited Vacation (yes, we want you to have a work-life balance)
Great medical, dental, vision benefits
If in Utah, a stellar onsite gym with local professional coaches, morning and night classes offered
Life insurance, long and short-term disability coverage
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Swag

Our public health group is growing and we’re currently seeking a Public Health Data Analyst to work in Atlanta, GA.

Job Description and Key Responsibilities:

The Public Health Data Analyst , primarily using SAS and MS Access , will contribute to cleaning, editing, and processing the Center for Disease Control and Prevention’s Medical Monitoring Project (MMP) data. In addition, the resource will lead and contribute to advanced data analysis requests using MMP data. A few responsibilities include, but not limited to, are below:

Provide analysis and interpretation of data using SAS.
Maintain, update, and enhance existing MS Access database containing survey questionnaire information.
Develop presentation graphics; definitions of variables for survey questionnaires, including variable names, range labels, default values, and question strings.
Review data collection instruments and protocols, including SOPs; update existing instruments, protocols, and SOPs, as needed.
Oversee data quality control processes, formulating processes and workflows for data collection, refinement, and management.
Automate tasks within the data collection, cleaning, review, and management process, as possible (e.g., writing scripts to update or correct mislabeled data as definitions get revised or allocation is attributed to a different domain).
Generate data retrievals and summary outputs.
Work collaboratively with leadership to resolve data collection/management issues.
Support dissemination and reporting of data to stakeholders.

Basic Qualifications:

BS/BA degree in Public Health, Statistics, or related field.
1+ years' MS Access database software experience.
2+ years' demonstrated experience with SAS programming in the following areas:
Understanding of relational tables and macros; ability to perform data linkages.
Experience in managing, merging, and analyzing large SAS survey data sets and understanding design variables including weights, clusters and strata
Expertise in large database manipulation, transfer and storage.
Expertise in modeling including linear regression and logistic regression.
Experience in generating SAS-based reports using a variety of methods (e.g., PROC REPORT) and exporting those reports to other formats such as Microsoft Excel, and RTF.
Skill in manipulating and cleaning data using a variety of SAS functions, formats/informats, macros, and procedures.

Preferred Skills/Experience:

Master’s degree in Public Health, Statistics, or related field.
Experience with HIV data or similar.

Professional Skills:

Excellent time management and organizational skills and ability to meet short work deadlines.
Detail-oriented and able to create meticulous documentation.
Excellent oral and written communication skills: experience with written and oral presentation of data, ability to interact professionally with senior research staff and CDC.
Ability to work independently to develop and troubleshoot SAS programs.
Ability to communicate and teamwork with a group to perform complex tasks.
Commitment to generating accurate data and products, keep good documentation..
Ability to conceptualize and work within the big picture as well as the minute details

About the team


The Analytics team at Miro has a clear mission - use data to make better decisions. We are a highly leveraged team of folks who pride ourselves on finding ways to answer even the most challenging business questions.

About the role


You understand people and the HR team, and enjoy using data and analytics to bring order to ambiguous problems. From building visualizations to help our People team understand talent trends, to helping model out our plan to meet our hiring goals, you will bring the analytical power to help us win the talent marketplace.

What you'll do


You will be working closely with the Head of People and Head of Business Recruiting. The work will be split among the following 3 buckets:
Design source of truth tables for level 0/1 metrics. Enable access to key metrics and data for non-analysts. Promote use of 'self service' analytics tools by associated teams.
Help structure People Analytics at Miro - work with the stakeholder to identify the right metrics to track and guardrails to monitor to measure success. For example, help us understand our diversity and retention or model capacity based on historical data.
Measure the progress of the People team at Miro - build the core dashboards to help us understand the performance and throughput of our recruiting funnels.
Know where to find the right data to answer a question. Be persistent in ensuring data quality and resourceful in getting data that is not immediately available
Support everyday decision making process for People team
Build next generation reporting for team level 0/1 metrics
Participate in team meetings, understand key metrics of team performance, suggest key metrics and visualizations that need to be regularly reviewed
Provide the team with weekly metrics updates. Proactively analyze large week-over-week or Plan vs Actuals deviations. Recommend operational changes that can drive increased performance. Generate business hypotheses of what drove those deviations.
Find the stories buried in data and build insightful dashboards that enable everyone at Miro to be an analyst
Ensure the team leadership is focused on the most critical questions to optimize Miro's business opportunity
For example, produce recruiting competency factor analysis to improve our hiring process
Bring clarity to overall recruiting funnel and areas that strategically require the most attention
Be a vocal and proactive partner to stakeholders. Guide their line of questioning rather than just fulfilling requests. Provide insights and conclusions rather than data outputs
What you'll need
4+ years of Analytics experience
People Analytics or People Ops experience is REQUIRED!
Experience working in a fast growing startup is a plus
You deliver results quickly with iteration, instead of waiting for perfection
You love telling stories with data - numbers are key, but a business is built with people.
Cross-functional relationships and effective communication are critical to make an impact
Humble, no ego
What's in it for you
Excellent Medical, Dental + Vision health benefits
Scrappy startup environment with hyper growth potential where you'll learn best in class skills
Competitive salaries + Flexible time off
401k matching + Stock options
Free lunches + Office snacks
Be a part of a culture of learning that will take your professional growth to another level with collaborative + thoughtful team members
Distributed team across offices globally in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Austin, Amsterdam, and Perm
About Miro


Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With over 8 million users, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes.

At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!

Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!

Job Description
DATA ANALYST
Greater Flint Health Coalition – Flint, MI
Greater Flint Health Coalition (GFHC) is seeking a Data Analyst to work in its Healthcare Quality & Innovation Focus Area.
Overview:
The Data Analyst will conduct data analysis, aggregation, trending, quality monitoring, and reporting functions in support of programs in the Greater Flint Health Coalition’s focus area of Healthcare Quality & Innovation. Projects activities will include data analyst functions specific to the GFHC’s Clinical Community Linkage (CCL) Initiative, the GFHC’s Community Data Scorecard Project, and regional Community Health Needs Assessment (CHNA) Project.
The GFHC’s Clinical Community Linkage (CCL) Initiative seeks to improve health outcomes and reduce emergency department utilization of patients in the Genesee Community Health Innovation Region (CHIR). The CCL Initiative recognizes the impact social determinant of health needs (food insecurity, housing, transportation, employment, etc.) have on health outcomes and assists clinical providers in linking their patients to resources available in the community. In this role, you will provide reporting and actionable analysis to support operations and drive constant improvement in the CCL Initiative.
The GFHC’s Community Data Scorecard Project is conducted annually; it is a critical element of the Flint/Genesee County consolidated Community Health Needs Assessment. The Data Analyst will own project deliverables required from actions that include data entry, data aggregation, data trending, trend analysis, baseline research, and data outcomes reporting from a variety of public and private data sources. The position will work with a variety of internal and external stakeholders, with an emphasis on hospital, health plan, and other clinical partners including physician organizations, federally qualified health centers, health departments, and community mental health agencies.
GFHC is seeking a candidate who understands the intricacy of healthcare and public health data sets, enjoys efforts of data aggregation and analysis, and seeks to make data actionable for healthcare and community health improvement strategy implementation. On a daily basis, the Data Analyst will interact with a wide range of health professionals in a fast-paced environment where constant change is the norm. You will identify trends in data, provide clear reporting on program performance, establish metrics, reconcile data, create methods of error checking, review analytics, and measure strategies to improve the linkage of community residents to resources to address their social determinant of health needs. Your work will support effective clinical decision making, ensure effective community linkages, improve efficiency and care delivery, foster information sharing, and make knowledge and data actionable.
Flexibility and a commitment to continuous learning will be required of the successful candidate.
Primary Responsibilities:
Serves as the primary Data Analyst supporting the GFHC Clinical Community Linkage Initiative and Community Data Scorecard Project.
Data entry, aggregation, trending, analysis, and quality control functions.
Owns the maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive
key programmatic decisions.
Formulates new internal processes and analytical reports to improve information
resources.
Monitors industry standards and trends to assure continuity of data reporting as available data evolves.
Gathers data from departments; updates periodic reports; analyzes statistical data to
identify and correct errors and to evaluate general content.
Proactively researches requests for baseline measures and related assistance and recommends solutions or process improvements that will meet program needs.
Performs review analyses, including accumulation of data, forecast modeling, reporting
and monitoring of responses.
Designs data acquisition methods and collection efforts.
Develops ad-hoc reports to conduct data analysis and validation.
Analyzes trends to recommend process and/or operational improvements.
Creates procedures to document report generation.
Manages timelines, activities, documentation, and deliverables while maintaining
alignment with program objectives and work-plan requirements.
Participates in quality assurance, continuous improvement efforts, identifying system
and process issues.
Supports the mission, vision, values and key strategies of the Greater Flint Health
Coalition and development of collaborative relationships with the organizations that
interface with the program.
Collaborates with GFHC staff and other stakeholders to promote shared understanding and appropriate use of reported data.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications & Experience Required:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
2+ years of experience in relevant health care, health education, data management, or business domains, including healthcare information management or analytics, project coordination, or technology.
Bachelor’s degree in Public Health, Health Education, Statistics, Data Analytics, Business, Epidemiology, or related discipline (Master’s Degree a plus).
Knowledge of databases and reporting from databases required; experience with data analytic applications such as SQL, SAS, SPSS, Stata, etc. is a plus.
Understanding of statistical concepts and techniques.
Competent in Microsoft Office computer applications (including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access), internet usage, and use of office machines.
Prioritization, multi-tasking, and organizational skills, and a strong attention to detail.
Demonstrate a high level of critical thinking and problem-solving skills in order to make sound assessments, implement plans, and re-evaluate program outcomes.
Maintains a high level of confidentiality and acceptance of diverse populations.
Demonstrates ability to work within a team-based environment and works in compliance with organization, state, and federal rules.
Demonstrates interest and ability in continuous quality improvement; receptive to feedback.
Knowledge of HIPAA and prior experience in a health care setting a plus.
Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills and an ability to present self in a courteous, tactful, and professional manner.
Considerate, attentive, and punctual.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

At MITRE, people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges. We’re committed to the long-term well- being of our employees.

MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with a focus on making the world safer, healthier, and more secure. R&D centers that we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as, healthcare, cybersecurity, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth.

Through the Health federally- funded research and development center (FFRDC), MITRE exclusively serves in the public interest and helps to bring world-class expertise to bear on key challenges facing the nation. MITRE operates the Health FFRDC on behalf of US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). MITRE serves as an objective, independent, not for profit advisor supporting many of the complex analysis and critical thinking requirements that encompass business, policy, technology, and operational interests across HHS.

Basic Functions:
Conduct analysis on large health data sets (e.g., electronic health records, clinical data) using data science tools and methods.
Analyze analytical outputs using expertise in biomedical sciences, health and healthcare, and industry best practices to create actionable recommendations.
Perform data ingest, data preparation and validation in preparation for analysis using industry best practices.
Apply specialized expertise in data science, engineering, science/clinical research, ethics, or other health and healthcare-related subject matter areas to projects and tasks.
Advise and assist federal stakeholders as they plan and conduct biomedical research projects and initiatives.
Provide technical thought leadership and innovative ideas, which help sponsors improve computational analysis methods to solve bioinformatics research challenges.
Translate scientific business needs into required computing, storage, tool and other technical requirements
Create reports and presentations for both lay and professional public health audiences that disseminate finding and promote recommendations to improve health outcomes.
Participate in highly functional and creative teams while building knowledge and working relationships across the Corporation.
Develop working relationships within MITRE across all levels of staff and management to leverage the Corporation’s deep experience across a broad set of domains.
Serve as a technical resource to other staff, including MITRE health care experts with backgrounds in law, health IT and other fields.
Required Education/Experience/Skills/Certifications:
Master’s degree in science, computer science, engineering, and/or a health-related field.. A Bachelor’s degree coupled with related experience may be acceptable.
Hands on technical expertise in statistical computing and data analytic programming and/or scripting in Python and Python libraries required; R, SQL, SPARK, data visualization tools (Tableau, Jupyter, etc.) a plus.
Solid understanding of the healthcare industry, including government and private healthcare organizations; knowledge of the data systems and formats used in federal health systems a plus.
A strong track record of successfully delivering on deadlines.
Exceptional organizational skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Self-starter with excellent written and oral communication skills required.
Ability to work out of MITRE’s Bedford MA, Baltimore MD or McLean VA campuses is preferred. Professionals who can successfully collaborate via teleworking will be most welcome to apply.
Desired Education/Experience/Skills/Certifications:
Advanced scientific knowledge of electronic health records, cancer research, and clinical trials - including platforms, algorithms, tools and databases
Expertise working with the National Institutes of Health and/or a NIH-funded extramural research organization.
Demonstrated technical leadership and experience applying data sciences techniques, to include artificial intelligence, machine learning, statistical modeling and/or data visualization

The Pennsylvania Employees Benefit Trust Fund (PEBTF), administrator of health benefits for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania employees and retirees, has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst. This position reports to the Applications Development Director in the Information Technology Department.

This position reports to the Director Application Development and is responsible for working on operational and analytics projects for the PEBTF. This includes development and delivery of Health Analytics services utilizing various data management and integration tools, reporting solutions, a standard project methodology and best practices to ensure that projects are delivered on schedule, within budget and with high quality.
The successful candidate for this position will possess the ability to: *
Interact with Trust Fund personnel at all levels of the organization to coordinate and deliver high quality data management and health analytics services.

Complete assigned projects ensuring that goals and objectives are accomplished according to defined priorities, schedules and budget.

Recommend methods for accomplishing projects and establish work plans and schedules for each phase of the project.

Develop work plans and document procedures for all functional tasks.

Prepare regular written project status reports and updates.

Provide trouble-shooting and problem resolution.

Analyze, model and profile data to support common definition and classification of data.
Leverage analysis to promote high data quality, database optimization and high performing applications and reporting solutions.

Gather and integrate data from disparate sources. Evaluate and preprocess raw information. Delve into data to discover discrepancies and patterns and implement strategies to improve data quality.

Develop/generate reports and data sets that meet the informational needs of the Fund using various reporting tools and data sources.

Participate in the development of new programs to support all PEBTF products and services, lines of business and operating units.

Objectively analyze important issues, provide an impartial viewpoint, monitor progress to foresee problems that may jeopardize successful project completion and take corrective action to prevent or resolve any problems.

Suggest areas for improvement in internal processes along with possible alternative solutions.

Ensure compliance with HIPAA regulations and corporate Privacy and Security policies.

This position requires*:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Health Care Administration, Computer Science or a related field is preferred.

Three to five years of experience in progressively increasing data management and analytics roles in a corporate environment.

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases / data systems.

Filter and “cleanse” data by reviewing output, reports and performance indicators to locate and correct data and code problems.

Technical expertise regarding data models (logical and physical), database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques that span a wide range of health care operations,

Develop and implement (relational) databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Adept at query and report writing, presenting and explaining findings, and suggesting improvements.
Knowledge requirements *
General business knowledge,

In-depth knowledge of the health analytics field,

Knowledge of the business cycles in the healthcare industry,

Knowledge of Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) frameworks,

Knowledge of Data Warehouse (EDW) and data management systems,

Excellent verbal and written communication skills,

Strong leadership skills including the ability to run group meetings and chair projects,

Strong interpersonal and teambuilding skills,

Excellent PC skills including Microsoft Office tools (Outlook, Word, Excel and Powerpoint),

Excellent database skills including Oracle, SQL, Access,

Demonstrated ability to drive results to completion while managing multiple priorities and projects.

Must have experience and demonstrated ability using reporting tools including but not limited to SQL, SSRS, Excel and Access.

Experience in applying project management tools/methodologies including Share Point and MS Project.

Experience in planning, estimating, organizing and managing major activities.

Experience providing effective solutions to complex problems involving both people and business issues where there are time and budget constraints.

Ability to quickly gain knowledge of new business processes and issues.

Ability to effectively work with all levels of management and non-management personnel.

Ability to adapt to changing work requirements and assignments and to complete assignments independently.

Ability to quickly learn Fund operations and systems, both manual and automated.

We offer a competitive salary commensurate with background and experience, plus an excellent benefits package at the start of employment, a 401K retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, and a professional working environment.

CO-OP Financial Services is bringing digital transformation to the credit union movement. We’re creating innovative technology solutions that help not-for-profit credit unions best serve their members and compete with the big banks. As a result, our world-class team is growing faster than ever! If you’re passionate about technology and want to be part of a purpose-driven organization, this is an exciting opportunity to provide real value and help shape the future of human-centered financial services.

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst IV to lead strategic projects and other data quality remediation planning. This position serves as a team lead, mentors all other levels of data analysts and serves as an advisor to our business in matters of data, reporting and business intelligence. The Data Analyst IV advises on technology industry standards, tools, and practices as well as designs and implements best practices for the data analyst team. The incumbent(s) partner closely with business and operations teams.

What You Can Look Forward to
Leads strategic and enterprise level data driven projects.
Follows and advises on industry standards and advances on data driven technologies and tools.
Designs and implements best practice for the data analyst team.
Serves as technical lead and mentor to other less tenured data analysts.
Analyzes data to determine relationships between very large datasets.
Creates enterprise level end-to-end data flow diagrams and logical data models.
Develops very complex SQL, T-SQL scripts for various reporting and ad-hoc analysis.
Documents business requirements, source to target data mapping, collaboration with technology teams, design, development, testing, and deployments.
Documents System of Record on very complex data models and map to business process.
Creates data mapping specification designs, data feed specifications, data analysis and data comparison.
Develops and documents data remediation requirements and plans.
Regular and reliable attendance.
Responsible for reporting risks that are identified to the appropriate team and/or management. Additionally, responsible for managing, monitoring and reporting risks within the scope of your work area, to include, but not limited to Information Security risks.
Actively supports our CO-OP culture and embraces our core values of Work as Partners, Communicate Openly and Honestly, Demonstrate Excellence and Champion Change in all interactions.
What You’ll Need to Succeed
College degree in Analytics, Data Science, Data Management, CIS or similar, or equivalent training and/or experience.
10+ years’ experience as a data analyst or equivalent position where working with data is a primary responsibility.
10+ years’ experience with data technologies, process, data mapping tools with highly complex and integrated business models.
Ability to analyze data to determine relationships between very large and enterprise level datasets.
Data Warehousing methodologies and best practices.
Financial industry knowledge.
Agile methodologies.
Expert level knowledge of SQL, T-SQL, and SSRS.
Tableau Desktop Pro & MS Excel.
MS Office including Visio 2013.
Ability to lead large data driven enterprise projects.
Knowledge of Jira.
Ability to coach, mentor and lead others in the technology area.
Ability to identify and set best practices for the data analyst role.
Must be detailed oriented with ability to detect patterns from very large volumes of data with a focus on enterprise solutions.
Why Join CO-OP?


CO-OP is committed to fostering a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and connected. We are dedicated to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their value; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives. You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP’s commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. Our vast technological ecosystem facilitates more than 6.5 billion transactions every year and equips credit unions of all sizes to deepen member engagement and prosper in the fast-paced world of fintech.

Health benefits – medical, dental, & vision plus wellness programs and gym reimbursements.
401K with generous company match.
Tuition reimbursement.

Position Number: 351563

Location: Tarrytown, NY 10591

Position Type: Temporary

Required Skill Set:
Clinical, Data Analysis, DATA MANAGEMENT, Laboratory, Medical device, Regulatory Affairs, SAP, SAS, Statistics

Position Description:
*Only U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. can be considered as W2 candidates.**
Job Title: Data Analyst 3/Senior Biostatistician
Location: Tarrytown, NY, 10591
Duration: 12 Months, potential to go permanent
Schedule: 8:30 AM to 5 PM EST

Description:
• The Senior Biostatistician will be responsible for providing technical expertise in biostatistics and to lead statistical evaluations of development and clinical validation studies for new in vitro diagnostics devices developed by Client.
• The role will interact cross-functionally with members of Clinical Affairs, Data Management, Medical Affairs, Regulatory Affairs and Global Assay Development to ensure high quality of data and analysis results used in regulatory submissions.
• The role will leverage knowledge and experience in the areas of statistical techniques and programming to support product development goals within the Laboratory Diagnostics Division. This is an ideal role for candidates who are highly motivated, detail-oriented, have strong problem solving and scientific thinking skills, a collaborative mindset, and enthusiasm for topics related to biostatistics, data analysis, programming, presentation of data, and biological science. A willingness to share this enthusiasm with colleagues and to have fun is a must for our team.
• The position will report to the Senior Director of Pre-Market Biostatistics.

Responsibilities
• Responsible for designing, planning, and executing statistical analyses of studies directed towards the development, verification, validation, and monitoring of in vitro diagnostics devices developed by Client.
• Recommends statistical methodology for the evaluation of analytical and clinical study data.
• Interprets and evaluates test data and results of complex studies and develops appropriate recommendations.
• Perform detailed review of clinical study protocols and development plans to ensure that the appropriate sample size and statistical methods are specified to support study endpoints.
• Develops the statistical component of protocols for development-phase projects
• Ensure that clinical monitoring plans, data management plans, and statistical analysis plans are harmonized and ensure delivery of high quality data and analysis results for regulatory submissions
• Interact with members of the Data Management and Clinical Affairs teams to align statistical endpoints of the clinical study to data collection, monitoring, and analysis activities.
• Develops Statistical Analysis Plans (SAP) for clinical studies, maintains plan through life cycle of study, and executes analyses per plan.
• Develops statistical analysis programs to merge complex data structures from multiple databases, create analysis data set (ADS) and generate tables, listings, and figures (TLF) for reports.
• Participate in development of database clinical trial data specifications, including eCRF design, user requirements, edit rules/checks, query logic, and data validations. Ensures data specifications align with statistical analysis requirements and goals.
• Provides complex specifications and directions to clinical data analysts for creation of ADS and/or TLFs.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience
• Minimum educational background of MS in statistics/biostatistics or other quantitative field. Exceptional candidates with backgrounds bridging biological science and biostatistics will be considered.
• At least 6 years of experience in biostatistics supporting development of medical diagnostics/devices.
• Proficiency in statistical programming (SAS, R) and query of relational database systems (SQL). Certifications in SAS programming a plus.

• Experience with analysis of complex data from multiple source.
• Ability to work independently and in project teams. Highly motivated and driven to exceed expectations.
• Strong communication skills in English, written and spoken. Strong ability for public speaking in audiences with mixed backgrounds. Able to distill complex statistical concepts in simpler terms to generalized audiences
• This position will be remotely based.

#IND1

Overview
We are seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst as part of our growing Analytics and Insight team within Intuit’s Small Business & Self Employed Group. Be at the cutting edge of the FinTech industry - the SBSEG division moves tens billions of dollars in money for Intuit’s customers, whether it be ACH, credit card, payroll, lending, and whatever comes next. The successful analyst will work across functions (Fraud & Risk Operations, Data Science, Compliance, Marketing, Product, Finance, etc.) and use data to drive insights which help achieve Intuit Small Business Group’s short and long-term business outcomes.
Over the past several years, Intuit has begun to build strong strategic risk capabilities in testing and analyzing new ways to widen the acquisition funnel while maintaining acceptable risk. We’re looking for a candidate to help continue to build a strong analytics culture as part of the growing team. This role reports to the Head of Analytics & Insights.
What you'll bring
Strong business acumen and exceptional analytical ability with 2-5 years of relevant experience. Experience in Financial Services or FinTech preferred.
Advanced SQL and coding skills to perform data segmentation and aggregation from scratch. Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio experience highly preferred.
Good working experience with data analytics and visualization tools (Excel, Power Pivot, Tableau, QlikView, etc.). Experience with statistical analysis preferred.
Outstanding communication skills with the ability to deftly negotiate, prioritize across teams, influence decision makers and build consensus with teams.
High degree of accountability, organization and empathy.
Experience working with Key Performance Indicator metrics such as conversion rates, user acquisition, conversion and retention and/or product usage.
Experience using predictive analytics and forecasting techniques.
Bachelor’s Degree in Quantitative Field or commensurate experience. Master’s degree advantageous.
How you will lead
Coordinate with Risk, Compliance, and Operations leaders, database engineers and executives to accomplish the following:
Translate business questions into verifiable hypotheses and make decisions through testing.
Leverage data to understand our Small Business money movement Fraud, Financial and Compliance Risk in depth and identify trends that indicate elevated risk and inform and influence Risk Policy where applicable.
Proactively identify areas of opportunity and suggest projects to mitigate risk while providing an awesome and delightful customer experience.
Work with engineers to develop, test, and maintain accurate tracking, capturing and reporting of key Fraud Risk & Compliance metrics via server-side data collection and other database sources.
Maintain and improve a set of automated reporting to provide the basis for in-depth analysis and business evaluation; in doing so provide the standardized logic for Risk analysts to build upon.
Use tools and programs such Microsoft SQL Server (SSRS, SSAS), Excel, Python, Tableau, QlikView and many other internal tools to work efficiently at scale.
Provide analysis and insight that help manage Fraud & Compliance policies such as anti-money laundering and approvals/underwriting for all money movement products.
Utilize predictive modeling and other advanced techniques to prevent money laundering, acceptable use violations, first and third party fraud attacks.
Partner with Risk & Compliance Operations to provide analysis and reporting that enables efficient Risk processes and results in improved metrics and performance.

Job Title: Data Analyst - ETL and General Analytics
Job Description:
Data Analyst - ETL and General Analysis
About Us
We are a smaller and rapidly growing team of data nerds. The data science team at SimioCloud handles many different projects and we are looking to add our next team member. We are a group of passionate technology professionals who are committed to delivering best-in-class data, data science and software solutions for the nonprofit space. We care deeply about our clients’ needs and understand that the work we do has a direct impact on their ability to improve the lives of many people and further their missions. We believe in our people and our team as a place for growth, contribution and exciting challenges.
About the Job
You will become the newest team member in a group with a diverse background from many industries coming together to build products from the ground up.
As a data analyst you will help us organize, manage and ETL various data elements. You will be responsible for running ad hoc and prebuilt analytic products in a cloud-based environment as well as directly contributing to the development and enhancements of those products. You will learn and be expected to understand the business needs of our data, how we apply it and what we build from it. In this role you will have visibility and growth into many different areas of Analytics, Data Science and Engineering Development. You will be challenged to learn new things and your input to make enhancements is expected. Your key responsibilities include:
· ETL of data, writing SQL and working with databases
· The ability to troubleshoot errors and overcome technical challenges
· The ability to comprehend the business applications of the data
· Operate between various environments from disk to cloud with the appropriate tools
· Keep organized and contribute to a system that allows growth
· Consult with developers and other data people as well as non-technical marketing partners and clients
Additional Responsibilities
· Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
· Enhancing data collection procedures for building analytic systems
· Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
· Participating in Agile workflows to tackle larger development efforts
· Develop simple automated scripts and basic tools that move products forward
About You - Skills and Qualifications
We are looking for individuals who are energized by challenge, growth and change; for individuals that want to build products and solutions in a fast-paced business environment.
· Be an aggressive life-long learner
· Can navigate around changing environments to accomplish tasks
· Skills with database manipulation and writing query languages such as SQL
· Experience with data tools like Alteryx
· Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R or Python
· Exceptional communication skills
· Experience with data visualization tools, such as PowerBI
Education / Experience
The ideal candidate will have some combination of the following experience/education:
· Advanced Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or Computer Science
· 1+ year experience in a business environment with an emphasis in consumer marketing
· Experience with consumer data products
· Previous technical training and hands-on data work
About SimioCloud:
SimioCloud with office locations in Westminster, CO is part of Moore and brings creative solutions, powerful technology, and cost-effective products to the nonprofit industry.
This role is based in Westminster, CO and the team is located in that area. Currently this role will be remote due to COVID-19 until safe for everyone to regroup in an office location.

Excellent communication skills for conveying technical material to non-technical audiences

The Lead Data Analyst is responsible for providing support in the critical areas of fraud prevention and payment analytics for Chick-fil-A's Treasury department. This role will focus on developing robust fraud mitigation strategies, coordinating with subject matter experts and key stakeholders to understand the needs of the business, defining and providing fraud performance goals and metrics, and creating/driving internal processes and systems to ensure appropriate due diligence is applied to business decisions. Leverage multiple, large data sources to research and create detailed dashboards related to ecommerce, online and retail fraud
Using analytical techniques, identify new and emerging patterns of fraud and make recommendations for new operational controls and improved monitoring
Quantify and forecast the cost of fraud on the corporate and restaurant level

Understand Chick-fil-A's risk standards and procedures
Strong understanding of Chick-fil-A's payment acceptance options and technologies

Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, MIS or IT related field
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Excellent analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills
3-5 years of data analytics, fraud prevention or risk management experience
Strong interpersonal & written communication skills
Ability to drive large pieces of work independently
Aptitude and willingness to get involved in the details
Ability to manipulate, question and interpret data in order to develop recommendations
Preferred Qualifications
5-7 years of e-commerce fraud prevention, investigation or retail fraud experience
Proficient in analytical tools (e.g. SQL, Tableau, Alteryx)

3

10%

Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Data Conversion Systems Analyst to work in Fidelity’s Workplace Investing Group in Smithfield, RI.
Position Description
The Data Conversion Systems Analyst is tasked with supporting data conversion solutions by improving the conversion process in partnership with internal IT and external business partners. The Systems Analyst is the primary advocate and liaison for the on-shore and off-shore developers for who they support during the conversion process. The Analyst will primarily be supporting data conversions under mentorship of Senior Associates; however will be 100% accountable for their work.
This resource will be supporting the conversion of retirement, 401(k) and define contribution funds and participants from clients to our platform, which means there will be a high level of scrutiny and pressure. The candidate will be working with resources which include business-facing teams, other systems analysts, as well as on-shore and off-shore developers – and therefore must be a phenomenal teammate able to work with a variety of organizations.
The Data Conversion Systems Analyst is responsible for the receipt of inbound data records, the creation of the technical conversion specifications to “map” these external records to the internal Fidelity specs, participate in the creation of the conversion strategy document by providing technical details to augment the business requirements, offer mentorship and support when it comes to the accurate creation and loading of the data to our systems and provide systems support to the project team. Works on multiple projects concurrently and contributes to timely and on-budget project goals.
Responsibilities:
Architecture
Aligns with data conversion and implementation standards.
Understands data conversion standard methodologies.
Develops original and creative solutions to on-going data conversion efforts.
Analyze client/vendor source data.
Design
Performs independent and complex functional data analysis for multiple projects supporting several data conversions at one time.
Designs/improves conversion technical specifications (known as the Data Element Listing) to support the data conversion effort. Documents detailed instructions for data conversion.
Performs functional analysis for projects to support the creation of other project documentation (such as the Conversion Strategy Document).
Participates in data conversion design and accuracy review.
Development / Execution
Plans and coordinates project schedules and coordinates with senior associates, external vendors and internal contacts for project assignments.
Receives data from external record keepers and posts those records to the mainframe environment for programmer use.
Reviews external records for file layout consistency, adjusting requirements where needed.
Interacts with external record keepers to understand and decipher file layouts in order to convert them to Fidelity layouts.
Establishes partnerships across multiple businesses and functions.
Testing
Performs conversion testing by reviewing conversion reports.
Supports conversion testing corrections for any conversion problems.
Assists in the planning and conducting of client/user review of conversion results (reports and implementation of corrections)
Supports and performs all phases of testing leading to the data conversion of implementation
Deployment
Responsible for supporting implementation of moderate-scope to major data conversions.
Responsible for post-installation testing and correction of any conversion problems.
Documentation
Develops comprehensive documentation for all data conversions
Responsible for post-installation testing correction of any conversion problems.
Assists data conversion team working with associates across various functions.
Raises data conversion project issues to senior associates and managers.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree preferred.
2+ year’s experience - demonstrable understanding of the data conversion implementation processes including analysis, design, problem resolution and planning.
Experience in Financial Services, Banking, 401(k), Define Contribution, Mixed Election, Retirement funds is highly preferred.
Solid grasp of Investment industry is needed.
Must be a “specialist” in Microsoft Excel, with a solid grasp of Microsoft Word and Microsoft Access.
Experience in data transmission protocols (such as SFPT, TSO, etc) is highly preferred.

Job Title: AVP, Master Data Management Business Analyst
Job Description:
CIT is a leading national bank focused on empowering businesses and personal savers with the financial agility to navigate their goals. CIT Group Inc. (NYSE: CIT) is a financial holding company with over a century of experience and operates a principal bank subsidiary, CIT Bank, N.A. (Member FDIC, Equal Housing Lender). Job Title: Human Capital - HRIS Project & Data Analyst
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

DEPARTMENT: Human Capital

POSITION TITLE: Human Capital Project & Data Analyst

MANAGER: Head of Compensation & HRIS

LOCATION: Hamilton, NJ or New York City

About Rockefeller Capital Management

Rockefeller Capital Management is a leading independent financial services firm led by President & Chief Executive Officer Gregory J. Fleming, offering global family office, wealth management, asset management and strategic advisory services to ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, institutions and corporations. The firm oversees more than $50 billion of client assets. Headquartered in New York City, the Firm also has offices in Atlanta, Boca Raton, Boston, Dallas, Los Angeles, Mountain View, Philadelphia, Salt Lake City, San Francisco, Saratoga Springs, Washington, DC, and Wilmington, DE.

Rockefeller Capital Management launched in March 2018 following the acquisition of Rockefeller & Co., Inc., the legacy Rockefeller family private investment office. Our firm is built upon the 136-year history of excellence in global family office and investment management of the Rockefeller family.

Position

The Human Capital Project & Data Analyst will contribute to and participate in the full life cycle of Human Capital projects and initiatives. Additionally, the role will support the Human Capital team through systems and data administration activities. The successful candidate will be instrumental in the design, implementation, and ongoing optimization of the Human Resources Information System (HRIS) with a significant focus on process automation and documentation, data analytics and reporting, and project management.

Responsibilities
In close partnership with the Technology team, contribute to the design, testing, and implementation of additional functionality within the HRIS platform.
Lead and/or participate in the execution of Human Capital projects across the firm.
Evaluate Human Capital systems and processes to determine areas of improvement and optimization, including the performance management system and personnel record maintenance process. Develop and carry out recommendations to enhance practices.
Oversee maintenance, security, and accuracy of HR data and employment records.
Generate Human Capital reporting and analytics to support leadership decision making.
Qualifications
1 or more years of Human Resources experience (or equivalent educational background) required
Bachelors degree required
Experience using a Human Resources Information System required (Microsoft Dynamics 365 HR platform preferred)
Data entry and/or reporting experience preferred
Previous experience leading or participating in cross-functional projects preferred
Skills
Proficiency across the Microsoft Office suite with advanced Excel skills; Power BI knowledge a plus
Excellent communication skills
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
Strong analytical and data management acumen with high attention to detail and accuracy

Who We Are

At True Fit, we believe when it comes to fashion, its all about the details.

True Fits personalization platform is strategically leveraged by 250 global retail sites, representing 17,000 brands and 175 million registered users. Since 2010, we have built the worlds largest data collective connecting consumers with apparel and footwear they will love and keep.

As our data collective continues to grow, so does our team! Lets disrupt this $3 trillion industry together.

True Fit, named a Top Place to Work, is looking for a Data Analyst.

What We Do

True Fit is building a comprehensive taxonomy of clothing products powered by text, image, user interactions, and manually derived data. The Data Science team at True Fit is leveraging this information to power the next generation of fashion recommender systems and help shoppers navigate the fashion world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to help us expand what we can do with our fashion catalog.

COVID-19 and True Fit

While this role is based out of our Boston HQ, due to the ongoing response to COVID-19 all True Fit employees are working on a remote basis, with a return date TBD. Once our offices are reopened, we can remain flexible and work together on a schedule that best suits your needs at the time.

Responsibilities
Contribute to ongoing efforts to expand the features of clothing we model.
Collaborate with Data Scientists to measure performance of recommender systems and devise improvements.
Develop a holistic, data-driven perspective on the accuracy, coverage, and consistency of product features.
Own the Science code base for product-specific analytics. Build centralized reporting mechanisms.
Work with Scientists, Engineers, and Product Managers to communicate important results.
Develop techniques for increasing stakeholder awareness across the organization.
Required Skills
Experience solving data problems using quantitative tools. For example, experience acquired with a Bachelors in a quantitative field (computer science, math, physics, computational biology; economics, psychology, or other quantitative social science; or related fields) and 1-2 years of work experience.
Experience applying analytical tools such as statistics to real world problems.
Experience querying large complex datasets with SQL
Experience writing data analysis scripts with Python.
Excellent communication skills.
Willingness to learn new tools as they become needed.
Nice to Have
Experience with analytics dashboards.
Experience or interest in machine learning and/or mathematical modeling.
Experience with big data tools and frameworks, such as Spark.
Previous experience working with clickstream data and/or transaction data.
Why True Fit?

One size does not fit all in what you wear or your True Fit career. Everyone at True Fit has the opportunity to push their professional boundaries, while balancing personal ambitions.

Together weve built a tight-knit culture thats reflected in our Glassdoor reviews; Great people, cool product refreshing place to work everyone actually works together like a team, employees are all pro-active and genuinely take pride in their work growth potential plus culture management is approachable, mindful of their people opportunity to learn/work on new technology you are an integral part of the success of the company the work you are doing everyday really matters and makes a difference managers provide autonomy and trust you really innovative company, open to share ideas to make a better product great culture with the right vision.

We believe that how we dress is an expression of who we are and the confidence we feel. As an EEO employer, we work to help all team members experience an inclusive, diverse and accepting work environment, so you can be True To You.

Reproductive Medicine Associates of New York (RMA of NY), a world-class, patient-centered, integrated, academic reproductive endocrinology medical center, is one of the nation's premier centers for excellence in clinical care, biomedical research and medical education. Visit our website to learn more: http://rmany.com/
Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Data Analyst. In this role, the successful candidate will execute ongoing analysis of research, practice management, finance initiatives related to scientific studies, health policy, health choice/behavior, health economics, and population health at RMA of NY. The candidate will work with a dynamic and active research group dedicated to determining the influence of practice care on patient health and cycle outcome. The candidate will assist in evaluating and interpreting data with a dynamic staff and collaborating researchers, students and physicians to verify results, conclusions and discussions for all production of but not limited to abstracts, manuscripts, social media post, and marketing campaigns. The data analyst will process data from conceptualization through presentation. The programmer/analyst will become a critical link that is accountable in his/her role to support the vision and goals of RMA while maintaining the center’s integrity as a strong leader in reproductive medicine. A strong area of interest for the group is growing our capacity to use machine learning techniques to enhance patient care.
Job Responsibilities:
Cultivate deep familiarity with methodological approaches and data from diverse sources including big data platforms, large administrative databases, small-scale survey data, electronic health trackers, GPS units and others
Monitor, evaluate and improve the quality of data; prepare reports, charts and tables of data for faculty and staff
Source, Clean, Blend and transform data from structured and unstructured data sources
Develop, manage, and improve databases to track provenance and versioning
Use various statistical methodologies and data analysis techniques for cross-sectional and longitudinal research studies ( e.g., Logistic Regression, GLM, mixed-effects, Chi-Sq, ANOVA)
Detect and address issues in data and analytic results
Accurately and appropriately interpret and communicate results
Develop programs, methodologies, and files for analyzing and presenting data
Clearly communicate processes used and results achieved, suggest new and alternative approaches
Participate in data-driven decision making with investigators
Conduct relevant literature reviews to inform cohort selection, variable definitions, and analytic methods
Assist in writing and editing manuscripts for publication.
To qualify you must have, at minimum, a Bachelor's Degree in Biostatistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Health Science, Public Health or Economics, Statistics or related research field. Master’s degree preferred. Strong statistical computing skills in SAS and/or Python and proficiency with SQL – understanding of relational databases and experience with querying and munging large datasets.
Experience creating data visualizations and dashboards (e.g. Tableau, Seaborn), knowledge of scripting language and analytical libraries (e.g. Python, pandas, numpy), integrating VBA macros with excel and MS Access and/or publishing for peer-review are desired.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, attention to detail and good documentation habits are required. Must be self-directed and able to manage priorities on multiple projects simultaneously. Must work and communicate effectively with staff. Strong ability to identify, analyze and solve problems, time-management and prioritization skills are required.
RMA of NY offers a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. We are located in a beautiful office in midtown Manhattan. If you are the outstanding professional we are seeking, apply now. This could be the start of something great. For immediate consideration, please submit your cover letter, with salary requirements, and resume to:
Director of Human Resources
RMA of New York
635 Madison Avenue, 10th floor
New York, NY 10022
Please visit our website: www.rmany.com

The Company: *
Arkos Health is a company that brings analytics-driven telemedicine to vulnerable senior populations nationwide. We help create healthcare innovations that will impact the lives of seniors and vulnerable populations in meaningful, lasting ways. Central to our mission is the role of the Product Manager.
The Position: *
The Senior Data Analyst will lead and perform complex analysis in an evolving data environment. In addition to very strong technical skills, this position will have superb business process analysis and interpersonal skills. The ability to extract and analyze data, clean and combine disparate data sets, and identify patterns and trends is needed, with the subsequent ability to query and synthesize the data into information consumable by client stakeholders and senior business decision makers. In this role, you will analyze and visualize data on a project basis to enhance develop products and reporting tools for Arkos’ customers and to provide insights on operational efficiency for healthcare organizations. Responsible for the full lifecycle of analytic activities to include: requirements gathering and data designs, development of analytic tools and reporting capabilities, meaningful contributions to data product development and continuous monitoring of performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. The Data Analyst will transform the data found inside of an organization into new information critical to business decisions. We are looking for a passionate Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.
Requirements: *
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or similar required.
5-6 years of professional experience in a business or data analyst role required.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques required.
Strong working knowledge and experience with scripting languages required.
Preferred languages include: reporting packages, databases (SQL, Access, etc.) and programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks).
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (Excel)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings. Professional poise and good communications skills a must.
Main Job Functions*
Select and use appropriate tools to perform data extraction, modeling, transformation, cleansing, loading, and interpretation.
Gathering Data - Collecting the data to be studied. Data may come from commercial databases, client databases, EMR systems, or other structured and unstructured sources. The Senior Data Analyst will design systems, processes and templates for capturing data then gather and analyze the results.
Design, create and implement programs and templates to collect, display and analyze data for assigned projects and/or Arkos customers
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources such as commercially available datasets, EMR systems, internal Arkos databases, and other repository systems
Maintain databases/data systems
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Provide consultation, recommendations and technical assistance to Prodigo customers in implementing data extraction routines; familiarity with PeopleSoft, Oracle, Lawson and/or other Healthcare centric ERP systems is an asset
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Cleaning Data - Once the data has been collected, in order to allow for proper comparison, the analyst must filter and "clean" the data to remove errors and ensure consistency and completeness of data. Cleansing routines should be used to identify like matches where data values may have been keyed incorrectly, may have partially matching strings or values may be missing. The Analyst will need some programming skills to write cleansing scripts to correct errors.
Write cleansing scripts to filter and clean data
Review reports, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems/gaps
Analyzing Data into Reports and Summaries - The Analyst is responsible to develop data extracts and reports. The Analyst will be able to interpret general requirements gathered from executives who need to interpret the data. It is the Analyst's job to determine the source of the data and design the appropriate reports or summary lists.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Design and prepare standard and ad hoc reports and summaries for statistical analysis and planning purposes
Filter the data, then selects a format that effectively presents the information
Dig deep into the data, using statistical techniques like correlation, regression or time series analysis to write reports summarizing the findings in a language the executive understands
Know which statistical techniques apply to a given problem, and then translate the results into information useful to the executive
Project Management - Works with the project team to define tasks and create team work plans with moderate supervision. Identify issues affecting work progress and recommends solutions. Communicate variances and potential scope changes in status reports. Control project costs, communicating any project-related expenses and recommend ways to control costs.
Document procedures for future reference
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
May develop and maintain web pages
May develop software utilizing various software development tools
Performs in accordance with Arkos’ competencies and professionally expected behaviors.
Performs other duties as assigned.
The Location*
Our Pittsburgh offices are in the South Side Flats neighborhood just West of the Birmingham Bridge. We also have offices in Phoenix, Tucson, Nevada, & Dallas. Remote options may be considered for exceptional candidates.

NYU Langone Health is a world-class, patient-centered, integrated academic medical center, known for its excellence in clinical care, research, and education. Also part of NYU Langone Health is the Laura and Isaac Perlmutter Cancer Center, a National Cancer Institute designated comprehensive cancer center, and NYU Grossman School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Enterprise Data Governance Analyst.

In this role, the successful candidate NYU Langone Health's Information Management and Governance team is responsible for data architecture, data management, data governance solutions and big data solutions. The healthcare data engineer/analyst will be a key technical member of this team, and will be responsible for big data engineering, data wrangling, data analysis and user support primarily focused on the Cloudera Hadoop platform, but in future extending to the cloud. The data engineer must have strong hands-on technical skills including conventional ETL and SQL skills with programming as well as data science languages such as Python and R, using big data techniques.

Requirements analysis, planning and forecasting for Hadoop data engineering/ingestion
Operational support for data ingestion and engineering, including job monitoring; issue resolution; user support
Coordinate with infrastructure and offsite/offshore teams
Design and implement optimized Hadoop and big data solutions for data ingestion, data processing, data wrangling, and data delivery
Share subject matter expertise on Hadoop-related concepts and use
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for efficient extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources
Assist users with technical issues related to their use of Hadoop.
Build data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Create high-quality technical and user documentation
Minimum Qualifications:
