Strategic Analysis, Inc, (SA) is seeking a highly organized Data Analyst to provide data analysis, visualization, and related support to the Director for Defense Laboratories and Personnel within the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering (OUSD(R&E)). The Defense Laboratories and Personnel Office carries out a range of core functions related to the 63 defense laboratories, warfare centers, and engineering centers, including the aggregation of data, analysis of capabilities, alignment of activities, as well as advocacy for the laboratories and centers.

In addition to DoD laboratory matters, the Director leads the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) Development Office within the DoD; ensures interchange with Allied friendly nations; and provides advice and assistance in developing policies for rapid technology transition within the Department.

This is an exciting role offering the chance to work in a dynamic and collaborative OSD organization with colleagues that are passionate about their work. Telework options are available. Qualified candidates must be local to the National Capital Region (Washington, DC metro area) to be considered.

Job Description

As a data analyst, you will:
Conduct research across various sources to support the Director s oversight and assessment of activities related to the DoD laboratories and warfare centers, FFRDCs, UARCs, STEM and Technology Transfer programs.
Define data search criteria, establish cross references from multiple datasets, draw conclusions about the information the datasets contain, determine trends, and interpret the data into visual representations and reports.
Assess requirements and recommend data management tools and systems that are compliant with DoD IT systems and develop and implement standard data collection processes.
Perform in-depth analysis of existing data and provide recommendations for data not currently tracked or recorded.
Generate performance metrics for the Laboratory
Provide recommendations for the visualization of information.
Interpret data; analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports and feedback.
Create visual representations, graphs, charts, and tables for a wide range of data.
Organize and deliver data in decision-quality form for use in executive briefings, reports to Congress, and other messaging.
Support the development of responses to Departmental, Federal, and Congressional data calls and requests for information.
Maintain data in appropriate databases, verify accuracy in data sets, and assist in the resolution of data anomalies.
Job Requirements

Education
A bachelor s degree from an accredited college or university is required.
Degree requirement waived in lieu of significant recent and relevant work experience: minimum of five (5) years active duty military or minimum of ten (10) years experience.
Experience and Skills
Five (5) years recent and relevant experience with demonstrated progressive responsibility in support of the DoD enterprise is preferred.
Must be technically proficient in visualization tools like Tableau or ArcGIS, and function as the subject matter expert for these tools supporting DoD STEM programs.
Exceptional oral and written communication
Demonstrated ability to perform at a high-level under short deadlines is required.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and prioritize work assignments.
Clearance
Active DoD Secret clearance is required
Top Secret clearance preferred

About the Role:
Data Analyst will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining reports using various software systems based on business needs. Must be able to research, organize, and simplify data. Analyze data for trends using current and historical information and communicate relevant findings to the appropriate department(s). Data Analyst will be committed to continuously improving data collection, sensitive to change, and be able to prioritize based on current needs
The ability to build strong working relationships is necessary, in this role you will serve as a liaison among several management levels to provide consistent and ongoing organizational support. Adaptability and precision are expected.
Qualifications:
Minimum 2+ years’ experience in reporting/data collection
Experience with SQL, Excel, Tableau, Crystal or similar business analytic programs
Bachelor's Degree preferred - equivalent work experience may be considered

Job Title: Facilities Support Quality Assurance Data Analyst
Job Description:
About Us: Gore is a materials science company focused on improving lives through discovery, product innovation and rewarding careers for our Associates. Learn More.

About the Industry: Saving lives and improving the quality of life for patients is at the core of everything we do. This meaningful work gives purpose to our lives and inspires us to create solutions that make a difference in the lives of others. Learn more at gore.com/products/industries.

About the Role: We are seeking a Facilities Support Quality Assurance Data Analyst to join our team in Phoenix or Flagstaff, Arizona. In this role, you will support the Facilities Support Quality Assurance, Environmental Monitoring, and Manufacturing Infrastructure Validation teams providing data analysis of the various output parameters of the various Critical Utilities supporting MPD Manufacturing Processes. You will provide support through partnership with the Quality System Process Owners for Environmental Monitoring and Infrastructure Validation by assuring the timely and accurate analysis of trends associated with various monitoring parameters. Additionally, you will work closely with many associates within the Quality Assurance Function to assure that Data Summaries and Trend Reports are prepared in a timely manner so that they can be used to assess overall system performance in addition to the demonstration of Regulatory Compliance.

Responsibilities:
In compliance with the MPD Quality System schedule, coordinating, and driving the Monthly and Quarterly Trend Analysis of Facility Level Environmental Monitoring and Control Data and assure Quality System approval
Developing an understanding of and helping drive the strategy for Environmental Monitoring data collection and management including integration with divisional and enterprise systems
Developing, validating, and maintaining the programs and processes necessary to analyze Facilities Support Data
Developing the dashboards and metrics to track key performance indicators (KPIs) for both Environmental Monitoring and Manufacturing Infrastructure Validation processes
Partnering with applicable associates and teams on ad hoc data analysis and reporting needs
Participating in functional and cross-functional improvement initiatives
Maintaining knowledge of industry standards as well as applicable regulations
Maintaining compliance with training expectations as required for this position
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, or Business AND at least 2 years Data Management and/or Data Analyst experience OR at least 4 Years of relevant Data Management experience
Successful experience working independently and on cross-functional teams
Strong Computer Literacy demonstrated using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Strong organizational skills, flexibility, and attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Desired Qualifications:
Experience with SAS and/or SQL
Experience with database reporting applications (Cognos, Discover, etc.)
Familiarity with governing regulations (eg. FDA, ISO13485) and industry terminology
What We Offer: At Gore, we offer comprehensive, competitive rewards in the form of compensation and benefits. Among these are work-life balance and sports programs, 401(k) Plan with a gift, Associate Stock Ownership Plan, Health & Well-being program with full health plan, and a flexible working program. Within Gore, you will find a unique culture, diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, and opportunities for growth and development.

Learn more about: benefits, diversity, and growth & development.

We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and inclusive work environment. In support of our values and continued success we are proud of Associates around the world who support an inclusive work environment, strive to reflect the diversity of the communities where we operate, and ensure all Associates and external partners are treated with fairness, dignity, and respect.

Gore is committed to a drug-free workplace. All employment is contingent upon successful completion of drug and background screening.

Gore requires all applicants to be eligible to work within the U.S. Gore generally will not sponsor visas unless otherwise noted on the position description.

Requisition ID: 1728206

MedStar Georgetown University Hospital is a not-for-profit, acute-care teaching and research hospital with 609 beds located in Northwest Washington, D.C. Founded in the Jesuit principle of cura personalis—caring for the whole person—MedStar Georgetown is committed to offering a variety of innovative diagnostic and treatment options within a trusting and compassionate environment.

MedStar Georgetown’s centers of excellence include neurosciences, transplant, cancer and gastroenterology. Along with Magnet® nurses, internationally recognized physicians, advanced research and cutting-edge technologies, MedStar Georgetown’s healthcare professionals have a reputation for medical excellence and leadership.

General Summary of Position:

Performs information management duties for the department, including data collection, management, analysis and interpretation. The incumbent also performs routine administrative functions in support of the department. These functions are performed in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations and Georgetown University Hospital’s philosophy, policies, procedures and standards.

This is not a remote position. Must be able to come in to the hospital for meetings and presentations.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’sdegree in health-related field. Master’s degree preferred.
At least three years of experience with data collection, management, analysis and interpretation, particularly in health-related field.
Experience with database development and maintenance.
Preference for Tableau Desktop experience.
Must be proficient with computer software, such as Microsoft Office; SQL; STATA, SPSS or SAS; Business Intelligence application, such as Tableau.
Must have knowledge of medical terminology and quality assurance systems.
Must have excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.

About MedStar Health
MedStar Health is dedicated to providing the highest quality care for people in Maryland and the Washington, D.C., region, while advancing the practice of medicine through education, innovation and research. Our 30,000 associates and 5,400 affiliated physicians work in a variety of settings across our health system, including 10 hospitals and more than 300 community-based locations, the largest visiting nurse association in the region, and highly respected institutes dedicated to research and innovation. As the medical education and clinical partner of Georgetown University for more than 20 years, MedStar is dedicated not only to teaching the next generation of doctors, but also to the continuing education and professional development of our whole team. MedStar Health offers diverse opportunities for career advancement and personal fulfillment.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY AND EQUITY
HPN is committed to creating a diverse and equitable environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. HPN recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status. Collaboration - We are a true network. We believe in the power and benefits of broad engagement, empowerment, and collaboration.

ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION
HPN Select is a national procurement solution for HPN members — organizations that share a common goal of helping people live in cleaner, safer, healthier, and more affordable homes. Our goal is to ensure the future of procurement for affordable housing, is simpler, more streamlined, and built for sustainability and efficiency. We are working to help developers and owner-managers connect with vendors in ways that make it easier to access quality and nationally available products at a fair price. And we are enabling greater visibility and transparency in buying decisions and smarter dollar allocations.

ABOUT THE ROLE
The role of the Procurement Data Analyst Associate is multifaceted. You will work with major customers to gather and analyze purchasing data associated with their properties so that optimal purchasing compliance across major vendor categories can be realized. You will also work on special projects that require an in-depth analysis of purchasing patterns that will inform specific actions that provide value to our customers. In addition, you will lead data-driven analysis around customer service KPIs.
You will help manage, interpret, and leverage its data and facilitate small and medium-size projects involving cross-department collaboration. You will translate data into information via reports and dashboards used to inform key organizational goals in business development, partnership management, product development, digital marketing, etc. This is a position with a great opportunity for professional development and growth. We are looking for an individual who is passionate about data and its value to an organization. The ideal candidate is a problem solver, pays attention to detail, and is comfortable in a fast-paced startup environment.
Designs and implements reports to support account, client, and global sourcing requirements.
Maintain data integrity of databases and make changes as required to enhance accuracy, usefulness, and access. Collects and rationalizes data from multiple sources. Ensures data integrity and accuracy.
Coordinates with the global sourcing team and peers to aggregate data and align reporting.
In addition, the role requires a capacity for analysis of data and both financial and statistical information, the administration and/or management of purchasing related projects and contracts, such as benchmarking and mini-competitions while also contributing to the wider work of the Housing Partnership Network, Inc. (“HPN”).

The role will report directly to the VP, Operations of HPN Select.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Support Account Management staff so that they can provide outstanding service to HPN Select customers and exceed customer service benchmarks
Analyze data generated by company systems and other sources to prepare reports for HPN Select for both internal and external publication
Measure sales performance against defined targets, reporting monthly on performance to the President of HPN Select
Communicate with client members via telephone, mailings, newsletters, electronic media, and site visits as appropriate
Undertake such training as may be reasonably required to maintain an appropriate level of technical competence for the post
Extract, cleanse, and upload various types of data to/from several systems
Monitor data integrations and troubleshoot problems as they arise
Develop and manage various types of internal and external reports and dashboards
Play an integral role in the documentation and implementation of a business intelligence system
Develop data collection procedures and policies to be implemented company-wide
Be a storyteller; translate complex data into meaningful insights to share with diverse stakeholder groups
Conducts basic financial analysis.
Assists senior personnel in establishing and defining program requirements.
Monitors progress of program requirements.
Interacts regularly with customers and other industry representatives to ensure conformance to customer requirements.
Assist in business development activities.
Performs administrative and analytical tasks in support of a contract program.
Participates in special projects as required.
Other duties may be assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field of study
A minimum of 2 years of equivalent expertise
Extensive knowledge and skills with tools to create complex queries, analyze data and create meaningful reports
Experience extracting, transforming, and analyzing complex and distributed data sets
Strong written and communication skills with the ability to organize and present clear and concise oral and written reports of findings and recommendations.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external partners.
Experience working in a consultative, customer-facing environment
Knowledge of QlikSense is desired, but not necessary
Knowledge in using Microsoft Excel at an above-average level
A background in procurement analysis
Ability to quickly learn new tools and technologies
You love data and understand how to manage it accurately and effectively
You have a proven track record of managing multiple data sources and maintaining integration of those data systems to present a complete picture of the customer
Basic knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions.
You consider the customer at the heart of everything you do and support and nurture an environment of innovation and creativity
Enthusiasm for the delivery of a high-quality service to internal and external stakeholders

Position may be performed remotely in the US

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst - Data Warehouse and Big Data
Job Description:
Your Opportunity


As a Business System Analyst, you will work on TD Ameritrade and Schwab Data Integration project. You will closely with business partners to understand the data and business challenges with data integration and to propose new functionality into the enterprise data warehouse. You will analyze data using SQL, identify and propose alternative questions, and design a data model and/or application data flow to deliver the business capability. You will be required to quickly learn Schwab’s business model, business vision and the associated analytical/reporting requirements. A successful candidate will be curious about the business and the data that enables it. A successful candidate will also be passionate about partnering with our business teams and exploring data to find the best solutions.

What you are good at
Act as a Business Systems Analyst in TD Ameritrade and Schwab Data Integration & Account Conversion project
Analyze the impacts of data integration on Data Warehouse and Big Data environment
Analyze and coordinate regression testing requirements across all lines of businesses
Analyze the performance impacts of moving Data Warehouse to Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Coordinate with source systems and downstream system teams to assess the impacts and implement a remediation plan
Coordinate with infrastructure teams, DBA’s, and admins to evaluate the performance impact on ETL jobs, SLA’s on data availability and plan on remediation
Analyze source system data, profiling data (using SQL and Hive QL), and arranging service level agreements with data providers
Design conceptual and logical data models (using ERwin), creating metadata definitions and creating source-to-target mapping
Act as requirements coordinator for 1-2 medium to large projects, capturing usage requirements and designing the semantic/information layer
Prepare and manage the project plans and recommending solutions
Partner with business users and acting as a liaison between business and technical teams
Coordinate data model review and handoff with the ETL development team
Building a deep understanding of the warehouse data and capabilities
What you have
At least 3 years of experience as a technical business analyst with a track record of delivering well-documented data requirements
Substantial experience in Data Warehousing / Information Management, preferably using Teradata database platform, Big Data and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Experience in working on large scale data integration and Cloud Migration projects
Expert-level SQL skills
Experience in data modeling (logical and/or physical) with a solid understanding of 3NF, Star Schemas, and performance concerns
Experience using Erwin
Familiarity with Informatica and Hive preferred.
Experience /knowledge of Project Management with the ability to drive projects to successful completion
Experience in Agile development methodology
Prior experience interfacing with various partners, including vendors, offshore development teams, and internal groups
Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skills
Excellent written/verbal communication skills
Strong knowledge of MS Project, Excel, MS Word, and Visio Drawing tool along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also required

BJ's Wholesale Club was the first retailer to introduce the warehouse club concept in the northeastern United States. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar operation with more than 200 clubs in 17 states from Maine to Florida.
While our Members know us for helping them save up to 25% off grocery prices every day, our Team Members love us for providing a supportive and engaging workplace that’s committed to developing great talent.
If you’re a motivated and enthusiastic person who enjoys working collaboratively and is committed to providing great service for our Members, we want to hear from you. BJ’s offers a fast-paced, team environment with great training opportunities and competitive salary and benefits packages to help you succeed.
As the Data Analyst - Club Analytics you will be responsible for providing data-driven insights that identify and diagnose specific execution opportunities in both the field and corporate office. You will have high visibility to Club Operations leadership, including the EVP and SVPs of Operations, and cross-functional interactions with other senior leaders within the business. This role requires an excellent collaborator, communicator, and analyst with extensive hands-on data experience. The successful candidate is a problem solver in a fast-moving and highly diverse environment and will be able to handle multiple projects simultaneously while ensuring accuracy and timeliness are not compromised. In addition to strong data mining and analytical skills, the Analyst must be adept at building effective visualizations and communicating findings to senior leadership and business stakeholders across the organization in both verbal and presentation formats using KPIs and metrics that are meaningful to the business.
Major Tasks, Responsibilities, and Key Accountabilities:
Build in-depth knowledge of BJ’s strategic priorities and club execution capabilities and processes as well as constructive relationships with senior leaders in Operations and other SMEs in the home office and field.
Mine data using various tools ensuring data validation and integrity and build easily consumable data visualizations for end user stakeholders.
Perform value added ad-hoc analysis in support of Club Operations leadership and other key stakeholders to include developing reporting and dashboards to track execution success.
Analyze vast amounts of operational, financial, customer and product level data and make recommendations about improvements and opportunities for increasing sales and profit.
Qualifications:
2-4 years of finance, analytics, predictive modeling and/or reporting experience, preferably in a Retail environment with an understanding of key financial metrics and sales mechanics (gross sales, net sales, margin, waste, profit).
BA/BS in Finance, Statistics, Economics, Business or other related quantitative field.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel (Excel w/ Macro’s, Access) and PowerPoint.
Knowledgeable in various data mining techniques and effective visualizations. Hands on experience with SQL queries and Tableau development. Alteryx, Tableau Prep or other data mining and statistical software knowledge preferred.
Pro-active and self-motivated work style with proven ability to collaborate broadly with flexible, positive attitude to get results within a cross-functional team.
Strong strategic, analytical and critical thinking skills; strong bias towards data-based decision making with the ability to break down complex problems and formulate plans.
Strong Project Management skills coupled with interpersonal and presentation ability with demonstrated experience in fact-based analysis, including the ability to persuasively present insights and recommendations to senior management.

WHO WE ARE
Cloud9 Technologies is a voice communication and analytics platform for institutional traders. We leverage cloud services including AWS, a wide array of web services, WebRTC, as well as advanced deep learning techniques to empower firms with the benefit of modern communication tools and enhance trader workflow with actionable voice data & analytics.
Our company was started in 2014 by a team of motivated entrepreneurs and highly successful industry veterans that have started several businesses and taken multiple companies through public offerings. We are well funded, with investors including J.P. Morgan, Barclays, NEX, and Point72 Asset Management. Cloud9 has been profiled in publications such as the Wall Street Journal, Forbes, and Waters Technology. Our award-winning technology was a named the 2017 Best Sell-Side Trading Communication System by Waters Technology for the second year in a row, recognized in the Top 10 innovative solutions of the year by the Futures and Options Industry Association, named to the CB Insights Fintech 250, and the FinTech Global RegTech 100.
By bringing together an experienced group of engineers, product managers, and industry experts, Cloud9 developed a communications platform for the trading floor of the future – offering more functionality and analytic insight than legacy hardware at a fraction of the cost. We’re a group of pioneers who enjoy solving challenges and building disruptive technology – and we’re looking to hire the best and brightest.
Join our team to contribute to the development of the most secure, compliant, and reliable communications platform in the financial services industry.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
The Data Analyst will collect data and develop analysis and reports to help Cloud9 make the right decisions to grow the company. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. Responsibilities include:
Work with executives and other leaders to identify opportunities for improvement
Create reports for internal teams and external clients
Collect data and analyze processes and requirements
Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions
Create and maintain documentation including requirements, design, and user manuals
Identify opportunities to improve processes and streamline operations
THE RIGHT BACKGROUND
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance, or similar
Coding skills in SQL and R (and Python is nice to have)
Experience with a business intelligence tool (ideally Looker)
Experience manipulating large data sets in Excel
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to contribute both independently and as part of a team

Job Title: Morgan Stanley Research - AlphaWise Data Analytics Analyst / Associate
Job Description:
Morgan Stanley Research - AlphaWise Data Analytics Analyst / Associate
Job Number:
3159505
POSTING DATE: Oct 15, 2020
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
JOB: Research
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Associate
DESCRIPTION
The AlphaWise Primary Research team collaborates closely with Morgan Stanley fundamental analysts, strategists, and economists on key investment debates. Building on a decade of experience, the AlphaWise Primary Research team gathers alternative data to generate unique analytics and insights. The group is seeking an associate with experience in data science to create, evaluate and analyze alternative data sets, in support of our Morgan Stanley Research Analysts. The role is dynamic, fast paced and interacts with multiple stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities
Partner with Research teams, quants/data scientists, and technology to create and enhance data sets that provide insights into key investment debates
Identify signal in alternative data sets to help forecast key company KPI’s
Analyze proprietary and/or third party data, develop transformation scripts, and remediate quality issues
Communicate and collaborate with Morgan Stanley Research teams around idea generation, proof of concept and data analysis / deliverables related to alternative data projects
Create efficient and reusable code meant for the improvement, manipulation, and analysis of data
Be aware of common pitfalls with basic ML algorithms (Linear/Logistic Regression) and how to combat these issues
Create and maintain standards and documentation (mapping, rulebooks, etc.)
Work with off-shore team members on product development efforts

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited higher learning institution (required area of study: Computer Science Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or related engineering degrees)
2-4 years of experience as a data analyst, data scientist, or related quantitative role; experience in banking/financial services preferred
Strong analytical and reasoning skills; able to decompose complex problems and projects into manageable pieces; comfortable suggesting and presenting solutions
Comfortable working in a large organization with a broad set of stakeholders across various functions (i.e., Business, IT, Operations)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills presenting complex analytical results to technical and non-technical audiences
Ability and desire to work in a start-up paced environment and culture

Technical Qualifications
Experience with using data profiling tools to query the data, identify anomalies, gaps and issues
Experience in Python and/or R (other modern programming languages such as Perl, JavaScript are a bonus) and statistical packages
Experience configuring technical architecture to support data analysis activities
Experience in data quality management
Experience in working with data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data environments/PIG,HIVE, Impala)
General awareness of data management practices, emerging trends, and issues

This is an entry level role for candidates with 1-3 years experience.

Responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Work with the quality team to identify key reporting metrics, and current database sources
Working with SQL and writing SQL reports
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Other duties as assigned.
Preferred Skills:
Bachelors Degree
0-3 years experience as a Data Analyst
Experience with Qlik, Tableau and SSRS

Data Analyst
Expertise.com connects over 8 million consumers annually to the best local experts in their area, whether they need a dog walker, financial advisor, or wedding photographer. With over 200,000 providers across more than 200 different industries, we dive deep into figuring out what makes a professional the best in their area of expertise and how to help the reader find the professional best for them.
We're looking for a Data Analyst based in the Los Angeles (Encino) area to join full-time. You will be joining Expertise.com at a formative time where there is large amounts of data being gathered (including site analytics, Google rankings, marketing operations, and more), but little of it exposed to the business. You will play a major role in tapping into this data to help shape & define the business strategy and execution plan going forward.
What You’ll Do
Influence business strategy by discovering and exposing compelling data insights
Translate data insights into actionable recommendations, balancing strategic objectives and tactical optimization
Ensure data integrity by testing and comparing similar data sources
Build and refine models to support business growth, such as pricing and forecasting
Consult with business leaders in Sales, Marketing, Operations, Content and other team members, helping define the business strategy

What It’ll Take
2 to 5 plus years of experience in a data-oriented role
Highly skilled in building queries using SQL & analysis in Excel
Experience building visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Qlikview or PowerBI
Experience with Salesforce SOQL (APEX is a plus)
Experience with Python and API creation a plus
Must be intellectually curious, extremely detail oriented and passionate about learning new technologies
A hands-on, team player with a positive outlook, an entrepreneurial spirit, the capacity to thrive in ambiguity, and the willingness to adapt to the needs of the business
Ability to work with diverse remote teams.
B.S. in engineering, economics, applied math, stats or any other quantitative field (preferred)

Who We Are
We’re a small but rapidly growing team driven by a bias-to-action mentality, balanced with a sense of humor.
We love to problem-solve creatively while keeping a sharp focus on the important drivers of the business.
We prioritize relentlessly to ensure that whatever we're working on is vital to our business' growth
We’re results-focused, but not afraid of failure as we lean into change and pursue our goals.
We’re open to new ideas and not afraid to break the status quo

Responsibilities: The essential functions include designing, developing, and maintaining relational databases for data storage and data mining. The incumbent will develop database solutions by designing proposed system and enhance existing data warehouse. In addition, the incumbent will ensure optimum performance techniques for data integration, coordinate deployment actions, and document actions; provide support to data integration and ETL components by coding utilities, responding to user questions, and resolving problems; and maintain overall performance of components involved in data integration through ETL by identifying and resolving production and application development problems. The incumbent will analyze defects and develop solutions and recommendations, if appropriate; analyze problems, design, develop, test, apply and document data corrections to databases; analyze and coordinate the resolution of technical issues, user problems and special projects with users, ITS staff and consultants, where applicable; analyze, develop and support reporting and the data extraction infrastructure, including the development and maintenance of metadata for reporting purposes; and develops and maintains system documentation, test cases and scripts and migration documentation.

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), the following is provided: The position involves skill in using a personal computer; oral and written communication skills; skills in proofreading and editing; use of clear and articulate speech; interpersonal relations skills; reasoning and problem solving skills; ability to work in a fast-paced environment; ability to sit for long periods, stoop, bend, reach and carry light materials (up to 10 lbs.); and ability to travel by various methods of transportation, e.g., airplane, car.

Required Skills

Minimum Education Requirement: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, or related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and skills may be obtained. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Five years’ work experience with developing interfaces using tools such as ConnectETL (formerly DMExpress), SSIS or Informatica Power Center. Experience must include sourcing data from COTs product through REST API, files, Oracle and SAP. OTHER REQUIREMENTS: Experience in enterprise integration of enterprise applications, business process modeling, and drafting of detailed architecture documentation. Experience with one or more leading RDBMS (e.g. Oracle, MS SQL Server, etc.). Experience with data integration (Real-time and ETL). Hands-on experience with PL/SQL or T-SQL programming. Experience writing complex stored procedures, efficient SQL Queries with Joins, and tuning for optimal performance.

Required Experience

Selection Criteria: Tier 1 (Essential): Proven experience in multiple programming languages, systems analysis/design, and project management. Proven ability to develop and maintain system documentation, test cases, scripts, and migration documentation. Advanced knowledge of data integration concepts and standard approaches. Proven experience with production automation, including designing and scheduling the ETL/ELT process for periodic automated updates involving FTP/SFTP file transfers. Demonstrated ability for automating update processes with built-in fail-over strategies, ensuring data consistency, data quality audits, and cleansing. Demonstrated high-level interpersonal and communication (both oral and written) skills; strong leadership and presentation skills; and ability to work independently and collaboratively. Ability to communicate complex findings and ideas in plain language. Proven flexibility and effectiveness in working in fast-paced environments and an ability to quickly provide insights regarding new data sets. Successful references. Tier 2 (Significant): Demonstrated experience with and working knowledge of MS SQL SERVER T-SQL, Stored Procedures SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Query Analyzer. Understanding of IT best practices (e.g. ITIL) and ability to apply them to departmental operations. Summary of Job

The Business Planning and Analytics team's mission is to empower ZipRecruiter with data through analysis, operational insights, and strategic initiatives. We're looking for a data analyst that is meticulous, regimented, and creative. Your goal is to drive ZipRecruiter's growth by using data to improve decision-making.

Your role is to serve as the interface between ZipRecruiter's data and our business, making sure that timely and accurate analysis is brought to bear on complex problems across our business. You will partner with business stakeholders in Product, Engineering, Finance, Marketing and Sales to make data-driven decisions. You'll use data and statistics to uncover new opportunities and empower business leaders making difficult calls.

We are hiring at the Data Analyst and Senior Data Analyst level, depending on experience.

Key focuses:
Define KPIs and create techniques for measuring business outcomes
Create readable and informative data visualizations to communicate data insights to business stakeholders
Using statistics to enable ZipRecruiter's continuous experimentation
Use data to identify strategic opportunities to improve ZipRecruiter's products and operations
Work closely with cross-functional teams in Product, Engineering, Finance, Marketing and Sales to translate findings into actions
Turn ambiguous questions from business partners into clear analytical problems, and solve them using data
Continuously learn and develop skills while working with our cutting edge team of analysts and data scientists

SQL experience
Exceptional verbal, written, and visual communication skills
Attention to detail
Structured analytical approach to problem solving
Ability to think creatively and to work well both as part of a team and as an individual contributor
Knowledge of statistics - R or Python skills a strong plus
Experience with experiments a strong plus
1+ year of experience in Analytics, Product, Finance, or Growth Marketing is a strong plus

Competitive salary

POSITION TITLE: Data Analyst

SUPERVISOR'S TITLE: Director of Corporate Integrity/CECO

GENERAL STATEMENT OF RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Data Analyst is responsible for improving service quality and advancing evidence-based practices through use of data collection and analysis. This position works collaboratively with agency managers and directors to assess outcomes, identify opportunities for improvement or areas of concern, and improve program performance. The Data Analyst utilizes traditional and innovative tools and techniques to collect and analyze data and information from internal and external sources, assess why unwanted variation in processes and outcomes exists, and identify how to change or redesign those processes to continually improve the quality and safety of patient care. Additionally, the Data Analyst provides staff with information and educational resources concerning incorporation and benchmarking of industry specific standards and evidence-based practices into program operations.

The Data Analyst serves as the primary coordinator of agency efforts to implement the CQI Plan and serves on all committees and workgroups which oversee projects relevant to the scope of the CQI Plan. The Data Analyst supports the IT Department in appropriately configuring the electronic health record to accurately collect, measure, and report on quality improvement data. The incumbent collaborates with the Internal Audit Department to design and execute strategies to monitor quality indicators and meaningfully analyze and report on quality improvement trends. Utilizing reports from the IT and Internal Audit Departments, the Data Analyst will directly support clinical program management to adjust operations and practices to address identified deficiencies and achieve program specific CQI goals. The position will support other activities within the Corporate Integrity Unit, as needed, to ensure agency compliance with regulatory and industry standards.

QUALIFICATIONS:

The Data Analyst must possess the following formal education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities:

Education and Experience:
Must possess a bachelor’s degree and 3-5 years’ experience in conducting quality and performance improvement activities through use of data analytics. Education and experience conducting data analysis in healthcare settings is preferred. Years of experience may be substituted for specialized training or education in the fields of information analytics, healthcare administration, or behavioral healthcare. Individuals in this position must have excellent skills in the use of information technology and must be capable of managing aspects of the electronic health record database after receiving on the job training in form creation, data mapping, and report writing.

The incumbent should also possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities:

Knowledge of:
• Data analytics
• Program evaluation and outcome measurement
• Database management
• Behavioral health services
• Electronic health records

Skills in:
• Oral, written and interpersonal communications
• Critical thinking and problem solving
• Use of information technology
• Statistical reasoning
• Informal research

Ability to:
• Communicate effectively
• Obtain and integrate knowledge on unfamiliar subject matters
• Collaborate with others on complex projects
• Develop professional quality materials and resources
• Work autonomously within the scope of personal competence and duties of the position
• Maintain accurate files and records

What You’ll Get to Do:

The Data Analytics Solutions Analyst – Junior is responsible for providing junior-level data analytics support for projects related to investigations and litigation cases.
This includes assisting the Data Analytics Solutions Analyst team as needed in support of analytics solutions for attorneys, investigators, and case teams.
The Data Analytics Solutions Analyst – Junior will gather a wide variety of data types from primary and secondary sources through diverse channels using a combination of methods that will be researched and employed by the Data Analytics
Management team.
The Data Analytics Solutions Analyst – Junior will assist with developing, maintaining, and enforcing streamlined and efficient processes for project lifecycles, from collection through transformation of data; and will support the
team’s goals for timelines, training, resources, and budgets in support of the finalization of client deliverables.
The Data Analytics Solutions Analyst – Junior will support the collection, documentation, vetting and onboarding of data, will provide input to the Data Analytics Engineer team on the database development and set up, and assist with validating the population of data into the appropriate analytical tools.

More About the Role:

The Data Analytics Solutions Analyst – Junior will assist in the defining, developing, and communicating data analytics solutions to support the customer. This includes:

Corresponding with key stakeholder personnel via regular consultations with clients to elicit requirements and provide regular status updates,
Performing data analysis and modeling to understand and identify data relationships/trends/classifications/predictions,
Building experience in all available analysis and visualization software,
Proposing reporting solutions that best present the information to the Data Analytics Solutions Analyst - Senior,
Providing regular status updates to the Data Analytics Solutions Analyst - Senior regarding assigned tasks,
Ensuring successful completion of work, timeliness of deliverables, and quality control, and
Delivering the completed solution.

This position requires strong analytical, problem solving, and communication skills with a keen attention to detail. Additionally, the problems and toolsets are quite varied, and the candidate should take the initiative to attack new challenges and learn new skills independently. This person must be well organized and flexible. We desire someone interested in a diverse skill set in data analytics and has current skills in either data analysis, litigation support, statistical software, analytic programming languages (Python, R, Java, SAS), visualization software, or database management.

US Citizenship required
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
1+ years of experience using analytics tools, methods, and visualization software

Tableau Software
IBM I2/EIA

Microsoft Power BI
Microsoft Azure cloud environment
Database (SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL)
Programming and/or scripting (Python, R, Java)
Natural Language Processing
Neo4j or other graph databases
Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud environment
Other analytic and visualization tools
Background in Law Enforcement, Data Science, Investigation, Data Analysis, Computer Information Systems, or Statistics
Experience supporting federal agencies
Industry analytics/business intelligence knowledge including current industry trends, challenges, and data quality approaches
General understanding of database, ETL, and analytics tools and concepts
Must be able to work independently and prioritize work effectively, as well as to function as an effective team member in a local and virtual team development environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an unsurpassed attention to detail
Excellent communication (written and verbal) skills

Experience working in AWS environments

Experience with litigation support, investigations, or administering Litigation Support tools

About NJOY:
NJOY is one of the largest independent vaping companies in the U.S. and a leader in the revolution against combustible cigarettes. With a clear mission to Make Smoking History, NJOY offers a range of electronic nicotine products for adult smokers and vapers looking for an alternative.
The brand was founded in 2006 and has continued to serve as a pioneer and thought leader in the vaping category. NJOY holds a contract with the National Institute of Drug Abuse (NIDA) to supply a standard research electronic cigarette for use in independent, government-funded clinical studies – a project with enormous potential in the United States and across the world.
Data at NJOY:
Every business unit evaluates its efforts in regular intervals using our BI tools. Goals, initiatives, and other business metrics are all measured and defined using data-based results with data that is centralized in our data warehouse. Our stack is rooted in AWS, and we have carefully engineered our setup to require minimal ETL maintenance. Our core data models are constantly advancing as we grow and collect evidence supporting advancement of our mission in an evolving regulatory landscape.
Overview:
You are a talented Data Analyst who enjoys partnering with stakeholders to make highly impactful decisions using data. You have an intuitive grasp of business problems and approaches to thinking across departments, and you are comfortable writing code as it pertains to analytics. You thrive within a small team, and you actively seek out responsibility and ownership.
Primary Responsibilities:
Partner with all departments at NJOY to make data-driven decisions critical to NJOY's success
Develop core analytic frameworks and data models that shape the way the company thinks
Help us build and scale the analytics infrastructure and data feeds powering this work
Build dashboards for recurring reporting functions and establish frameworks for exploration among stakeholders
Proactively inform and drive business improvements and operational decisions in collaboration with cross-functional colleagues

3-5 years of experience as an analyst with demonstrated expertise in functional or framework areas
Fluency in SQL & Python are required. Familiarity with VBA and R also appreciated
A deep understanding of numbers and business drivers with keen attention to detail
Demonstrated ability to balance many different types of analytics problems within a short period of time
Alignment with NJOY company values, empathy with stakeholders and a customer-oriented approach to collaboration with others
Clear communication of technical information in written documentation and spoken presentation. Everything you produce is cleanly laid out, robust, easily understood by others, and you can anticipate what will come next
Preferred Qualifications:
Considerations and decision making in software development
Experience with advanced analytic frameworks and libraries
Familiarity with the tools in our data stack: AWS, Redshift, dbt, Looker & Stitch
Why Work for NJOY?
You'll be working in a high energy, fast paced environment with a best-in-class team, collaboratively driving toward our mission to Make Smoking History.
Competitive compensation package with target bonuses.
Generous monthly fitness reimbursement
Casual dress-code and summer Fridays

OUR VISION: THE WORLD. SUBSCRIBED.

Customers have changed. They're looking for new ways to engage with businesses. Consumers today have a new set of expectations. They want outcomes, not ownership. Customization, not generalization. Constant improvement, not planned obsolescence.

In the old world (let's call it the Product Economy) it was all about things. Acquiring new customers, shipping commodities, billing for one-time transactions. But in today's new era, it's all about relationships. More and more customers are becoming subscribers because subscription experiences built around services meet consumers' needs better than the static offerings or a single product.

Our vision is "The World Subscribed" where one day every company will be a part of the Subscription Economy® (a phrase coined by our CEO, Tien Tzuo and author of the best selling book Subscribed).

THE TEAM

At Zuora, data is a key strategic pillar for operating our business. All our teams rely on accurate, timely data to measure and improve outcomes, including building better products, improving the customer experience, optimizing the sales process, and ultimately increasing the overall value we deliver to our customers.

The Zuora Corporate Data Team drives the overall vision of a "Company Powered by Data". The team's mission is to enable all other teams to manage and use data effectively to make better decisions, by providing high-quality datasets, self-service tools and guidance. We strive to maintain a product focus and treat other teams as our customers.

YOUR MISSION: To build and support high-quality data sets and reporting and analytics tools for internal customers.

THE OPPORTUNITY (AKA: Why you want this role over any other out there)

As a Data and Product Analyst on the Zuora Corporate Data Team, you'll have the opportunity to expand your skills in multiple directions, including data analytics, product management, and project management:
Computing metrics and KPIs related to corporate finances, internal processes and product usage, to help executives track the state of the business is real time
Curating a shared corporate data model that helps all teams to foster collaboration and communication about customers, products and end-to-end processes
Working with engineers to implement continuous monitoring and validation of data quality
Working with the team and with end users to design effective reports and visualizations for a wide variety of use cases
OUR DATA STACK: AWS, Python, SQL, Postgres, BI tools, custom internal applications

WHAT YOU'LL ACHIEVE

As a Data and Product Analyst, advancing your career depends on much more than your ability to solve isolated technical problems. Joining the Corporate Zuora Data Team will also give you the opportunity to develop the whole range of skills you need to scale your effectiveness as a product builder and organizational leader:
Working directly with end users in a variety of different roles to understand business requirements and identify appropriate technical solutions
Writing design and implementation documentation
Running a transparent, predictable product delivery lifecycle, including planning, testing and release management
Successful candidates for this position should be able to demonstrate a solid foundation as data analysts, aptitude for building data products, excellent communication skills, and a strong desire to learn. Desirable previous experience includes:
management consulting
building data products (such as the analytics features of a business application) for external customers
supporting internal customers as part of a BI or data team
performing the role of technical business analyst on a finance, sales, marketing or "growth" team
WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL
Complex SQL for data transformation and for analytics
Time series analysis for understanding trends
Basic statistical analysis, particularly for monitoring data quality
ABOUT ZUORA & OUR "ZEO" CULTURE

Zuora (NYSE: ZUO) Zuora provides the leading cloud-based subscription management platform that functions as a system of record for subscription businesses across all industries. Powering the Subscription Economy®, the Zuora platform was architected specifically for dynamic, recurring subscription business models and acts as an intelligent subscription management hub that automates and orchestrates the entire subscription order-to-revenue process seamlessly across billing and revenue recognition. Zuora serves more than 1,000 companies around the world, including Box, Ford, Penske Media Corporation, Schneider Electric, Siemens, Xplornet, and Zoom.

At Zuora, we have one CEO but every employee is empowered and supported to be the 'ZEO' of their own career experience. By embedding inclusion and belonging into our processes, policies and culture, we are building a workplace where our 1,200+ ZEOs across North America, Europe, and APAC can bring all the elements of who they are into their work. In addition to an industry-leading six-month, 100% paid parental leave for all our ZEOs, we also offer programs to support your mental health and give back to our communities along with "career cash" and plenty of learning and development opportunities.

To learn more visit www.zuora.com

Zuora is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

Think, be and do you! At Zuora, different perspectives, experiences and contributions matter. Everyone counts. Zuora is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all.

Zuora does not discriminate on the basis of, and considers individuals seeking employment with Zuora without regards to, race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)zuora.com.

Senior Data Business Systems Analyst
As a Senior Data BSA/Product Associate on the Transactional Data Products team within the Enterprise Data and Analytics, you will drive the ingestion and integration of core data domains to be leveraged by Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics teams to gain insights on the companies’ successes and opportunities. You will propel analytics through robust data comprehension, requirement mapping, data modeling, and cross-functional partnership. With this diverse role, areas of potential focus range from (1) data architecture design to direct business process evolution, (2) backlog prioritization and management, (3) reverse engineering to understand and evolve an existing solution, (4) researching a critical source system/service to automate ingestion, and (5) educating teammates on your robust knowledge of business data requirements and business process. This role will be vital in shaping the landscape by which analytics teams interact with and leverage data, as each release broadens available data sets and expands analytics self-serve capabilities.

Beyond these core competencies it will be very important for this candidate to be comfortable working with remote data science professionals. This assignment will be working specifically to support the recent Acquisition of Celect and onboarding them to existing data products as well as eliciting requirements to build new ones.
If you’re right for this role, you’re a data evangelist with hands-on SQL experience, agile product experience and a basic understanding of data architecture. In your daily work, you actively seek the most effective path forward, and are insistent on progress. You are equally comfortable working in a relational data store and a “big data” cloud eco-system. To you, the importance of value-based solutioning, incremental progress, and failing fast is clear, and you can demonstrate how each of these helps to drive business results. You enjoy finding relationships between disparate data sets and clarity in a muddied data environment. When it is time to simplify a complex technical idea onto a white board for a non-technical audience, you want the pen in your hand.

Requirements for this position include:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or other relevant areas and/or extensive work experience focused in data management and analysis.
Minimum 5 years of related professional experience required.
Proven ability to perform thorough data analysis and present relevant results.
Proven ability to sift through data, identify critical information, analyze, and develop solution options.
In-depth understanding of the Agile principles and methodologies and how they’re applied in workplace culture.
Be a Product advocate; can describe the Product, its value, how it works, how it is adopted, speak to upcoming changes and tailor the information to the audience.
Work directly with customers and team members to capture details of Feature requirements, understand use cases, collect samples, and find tests; apply knowledge of Product and business drivers to enhance work.
Ability to solve complex problems and take a new perspective on existing solutions.
Self-directed and comfortable working in ambiguous environments.
Strong presentation, written, and verbal communication skills.
Strong technical skillset (SQL, Data Modeling, Business Requirements, Big Data, Amazon Web Services).
Ability to mentor entry-level and intermediate data analysts and drive work within small teams.
Ability to troubleshoot technical and non-technical problems.

About NJOY:
NJOY is one of the largest independent vaping companies in the U.S. and a leader in the revolution against combustible cigarettes. With a clear mission to Make Smoking History, NJOY offers a range of electronic nicotine products for adult smokers and vapers looking for an alternative.
The brand was founded in 2006 and has continued to serve as a pioneer and thought leader in the vaping category. NJOY holds a contract with the National Institute of Drug Abuse (NIDA) to supply a standard research electronic cigarette for use in independent, government-funded clinical studies – a project with enormous potential in the United States and across the world.
Data at NJOY:
Every business unit evaluates its efforts in regular intervals using our BI tools. Goals, initiatives, and other business metrics are all measured and defined using data-based results with data that is centralized in our data warehouse. Our stack is rooted in AWS, and we have carefully engineered our setup to require minimal ETL maintenance. Our core data models are constantly advancing as we grow and collect evidence supporting advancement of our mission in an evolving regulatory landscape.
Overview:
You are a talented Data Analyst who enjoys partnering with stakeholders to make highly impactful decisions using data. You have an intuitive grasp of business problems and approaches to thinking across departments, and you are comfortable writing code as it pertains to analytics. You thrive within a small team, and you actively seek out responsibility and ownership.
Primary Responsibilities:
Partner with all departments at NJOY to make data-driven decisions critical to NJOY's success
Develop core analytic frameworks and data models that shape the way the company thinks
Help us build and scale the analytics infrastructure and data feeds powering this work
Build dashboards for recurring reporting functions and establish frameworks for exploration among stakeholders
Proactively inform and drive business improvements and operational decisions in collaboration with cross-functional colleagues
Minimum Qualifications:
3-5 years of experience as an analyst with demonstrated expertise in functional or framework areas
Fluency in SQL & Python are required. Familiarity with VBA and R also appreciated
A deep understanding of numbers and business drivers with keen attention to detail
Demonstrated ability to balance many different types of analytics problems within a short period of time
Alignment with NJOY company values, empathy with stakeholders and a customer-oriented approach to collaboration with others
Clear communication of technical information in written documentation and spoken presentation. Everything you produce is cleanly laid out, robust, easily understood by others, and you can anticipate what will come next
Preferred Qualifications:
Considerations and decision making in software development
Experience with advanced analytic frameworks and libraries
Familiarity with the tools in our data stack: AWS, Redshift, dbt, Looker & Stitch
Why Work for NJOY?
You'll be working in a high energy, fast paced environment with a best-in-class team, collaboratively driving toward our mission to Make Smoking History.
Competitive compensation package with target bonuses.
Generous monthly fitness reimbursement
Casual dress-code and summer Fridays
Frequent company-provided lunches
Company-sponsored happy hours and outings
Commuter benefits for transit
Competitive medical, dental and vision benefits
Fully stocked kitchen with snacks

OUR VISION: THE WORLD. SUBSCRIBED.

Customers have changed. They're looking for new ways to engage with businesses. Consumers today have a new set of expectations. They want outcomes, not ownership. Customization, not generalization. Constant improvement, not planned obsolescence.

In the old world (let's call it the Product Economy) it was all about things. Acquiring new customers, shipping commodities, billing for one-time transactions. But in today's new era, it's all about relationships. More and more customers are becoming subscribers because subscription experiences built around services meet consumers' needs better than the static offerings or a single product.

Our vision is "The World Subscribed" where one day every company will be a part of the Subscription Economy® (a phrase coined by our CEO, Tien Tzuo and author of the best selling book Subscribed).

THE TEAM

At Zuora, data is a key strategic pillar for operating our business. All our teams rely on accurate, timely data to measure and improve outcomes, including building better products, improving the customer experience, optimizing the sales process, and ultimately increasing the overall value we deliver to our customers.

The Zuora Corporate Data Team drives the overall vision of a "Company Powered by Data". The team's mission is to enable all other teams to manage and use data effectively to make better decisions, by providing high-quality datasets, self-service tools and guidance. We strive to maintain a product focus and treat other teams as our customers.

YOUR MISSION: To build and support high-quality data sets and reporting and analytics tools for internal customers.

THE OPPORTUNITY (AKA: Why you want this role over any other out there)

As a Data and Product Analyst on the Zuora Corporate Data Team, you'll have the opportunity to expand your skills in multiple directions, including data analytics, product management, and project management:
Computing metrics and KPIs related to corporate finances, internal processes and product usage, to help executives track the state of the business is real time
Curating a shared corporate data model that helps all teams to foster collaboration and communication about customers, products and end-to-end processes
Working with engineers to implement continuous monitoring and validation of data quality
Working with the team and with end users to design effective reports and visualizations for a wide variety of use cases
OUR DATA STACK: AWS, Python, SQL, Postgres, BI tools, custom internal applications

WHAT YOU'LL ACHIEVE

As a Data and Product Analyst, advancing your career depends on much more than your ability to solve isolated technical problems. Joining the Corporate Zuora Data Team will also give you the opportunity to develop the whole range of skills you need to scale your effectiveness as a product builder and organizational leader:
Working directly with end users in a variety of different roles to understand business requirements and identify appropriate technical solutions
Writing design and implementation documentation
Running a transparent, predictable product delivery lifecycle, including planning, testing and release management
Successful candidates for this position should be able to demonstrate a solid foundation as data analysts, aptitude for building data products, excellent communication skills, and a strong desire to learn. Desirable previous experience includes:
management consulting
building data products (such as the analytics features of a business application) for external customers
supporting internal customers as part of a BI or data team
performing the role of technical business analyst on a finance, sales, marketing or "growth" team
WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL
Complex SQL for data transformation and for analytics
Time series analysis for understanding trends
Basic statistical analysis, particularly for monitoring data quality
ABOUT ZUORA & OUR "ZEO" CULTURE

Zuora (NYSE: ZUO) Zuora provides the leading cloud-based subscription management platform that functions as a system of record for subscription businesses across all industries. Powering the Subscription Economy®, the Zuora platform was architected specifically for dynamic, recurring subscription business models and acts as an intelligent subscription management hub that automates and orchestrates the entire subscription order-to-revenue process seamlessly across billing and revenue recognition. Zuora serves more than 1,000 companies around the world, including Box, Ford, Penske Media Corporation, Schneider Electric, Siemens, Xplornet, and Zoom.

At Zuora, we have one CEO but every employee is empowered and supported to be the 'ZEO' of their own career experience. By embedding inclusion and belonging into our processes, policies and culture, we are building a workplace where our 1,200+ ZEOs across North America, Europe, and APAC can bring all the elements of who they are into their work. In addition to an industry-leading six-month, 100% paid parental leave for all our ZEOs, we also offer programs to support your mental health and give back to our communities along with "career cash" and plenty of learning and development opportunities.

To learn more visit www.zuora.com

Zuora is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

Think, be and do you! At Zuora, different perspectives, experiences and contributions matter. Everyone counts. Zuora is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all.

Zuora does not discriminate on the basis of, and considers individuals seeking employment with Zuora without regards to, race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)zuora.com.

Full Time Data Analyst (Digital Outreach)*
AlphaVu is a Washington, D.C. based analytics and outreach company that specializes in social listening, data mining, and machine learning for clients in the public transportation and infrastructure, public health, industry association, legislative, and policy industry arenas. Our analytic outlook is focused on social network analysis as a methodology aimed at creating growing, stable governing and business coalitions, rather than relying on outdated, reductionist market segmentation methodologies. Our techniques, combined with our real-world understanding of how people communicate and share information, empowers us to help our clients and partners deliver winning and unifying messages.
_AlphaVu’s Task at Hand_*
AlphaVu is quickly growing in the public transportation, infrastructure, and public health areas. We work closely with our clients in these industries to develop and implement outreach strategies based on analytic insights. AlphaVu is currently seeking a data analyst to produce client reports, manage digital outreach campaigns, and contribute to AlphaVu’s technological and analytic development. AlphaVu is also beginning to assist state governments in online contact tracing efforts.
_Job Description_*
Our new Data Analyst will work with us to create and deliver analytic reports to our clients. This skill requires the ability to quickly synthesize information within evolving strategic frameworks. It also requires superior communications skills, including the ability to write clearly and succinctly, speak publicly, and generate visual representations of complex ideas.

We also expect the Data Analyst to assist in client communication campaigns as needed and to become familiar with implementing online digital outreach campaigns. This includes creating targeted audiences and setting ad placements using insights gleaned from market data.

The Data Analyst will love working with and writing about analytics, all while helping to improve analytic frameworks that improve client and organizational decision making. A grounding in basis statistics is very helpful for this work.

AlphaVu is a small but growing company. Team members should feel comfortable working in a small office setting (and remotely as public health guidelines demand). Candidates should be able to manage work independently, enthusiastically contribute to team projects, and be adaptable to the immediate needs of a small business.
_Responsibilities_*
Collect and analyze social data from online platforms and AlphaVu’s proprietary data analytics software.
Manage and segment large datasets using basic R or Python code.
Synthesize large amounts of information into well-written reports and client presentations.
Create and maintain client dashboards and visualizations using Tableau.
Provide high-level customer support and communication for clients across our industries.
Develop and implement digital outreach and strategic communication campaigns, including ad-supported placements.
Understand and be able to use social media and search engine metrics in order to build and manage audiences.
Assist in the planning and production of social media content and blog posts for both AlphaVu and our clients.
Work with AlphaVu software engineers on our ongoing systems development processes.
_Required Qualifications_*
Bachelor’s degree in the social sciences, economics, statistics, public policy, or a related field.
Up to 3 years of relevant work and/or research experience.
Demonstrated understanding of social media advertising placement and search advertising.
Demonstrated understanding of social media performance analytics.
Expertise in the use of Excel.
Proficiency in R.
Ability to work both independently and in teams as required.
Passion for pitching in and working across boundaries and narrowly defined rolls in a small and growing company.
Very self-motivated, highly organized, pays attention to detail, and able to quickly master new skills and techniques.
Proficiency with Tableau and Tableau Server.
_Preferred Qualifications_*
Basic proficiency in Python programming language.
Understanding of machine learning concepts.
Experience with natural language processing on social media data.
Familiarity with Elastic Search and Kibana.
Salary and Benefits*
$60,000/year salary.
50% healthcare premium based on bronze reference plan.
Public transit compensation of $85/month.
Benefits estimated at approximately $3,000 in value.
Eligible for 401(k) with 3% match after 12-months of employment.

We are seeking a self-motivated Data Analyst to provide technical and analytic support to a small, high-impact team. This is a developmental position with opportunities for career growth along a Data Science track. The position requires an active TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance.

The Data Analyst will be expected to work with Data Scientists to build statistical models, test hypotheses, and interpret, summarize, visualize, and succinctly report data findings. The Analyst may be required to leverage automation and machine learning models to manage data, predict scenarios, and make recommendations to a non-technical audience.

The Data Analyst will contribute to building new analytical tools in support of the IC customer, and will be expected to collaborate with team members in a highly technical environment.
