Overview

The Cellular Therapy Data Quality Analyst will be responsible to ensure and manage clinical and outcomes data quality for a case management and outcomes reporting system for cellular therapy recipients. They will be a critical team member to participate in a data quality project to increase the integrity of converted historic clinical data. The Cellular Therapy Data Quality Analyst will report to the Data and Systems Quality Manager.

The stem cell transplantation and cellular therapies programs at Dana-Farber/Brigham and Women’s Cancer Center and Boston Children’s are among the largest and most experienced programs in the world. These programs have performed more than 11,500 transplants for the treatment of blood cancers and related disorders since they began in 1972, originally as a joint program, and have made major contributions to the advancement of research and care across many diagnoses. The programs have tracked and provided valuable data to the Center for International Blood & Marrow Transplant Research (CIBMTR), the official U.S. repository for stem cell transplantation and cellular therapies, since its inception and consistently exceed expected outcomes set by the CIBMTR.

The Cellular Therapy Data Quality Analyst will be responsible to ensure and manage clinical and outcomes data quality for a case management and outcomes reporting system for cellular therapy recipients. They will be a critical team member to participate in a data quality project to increase the integrity of converted historic clinical data. The Cellular Therapy Data Quality Analyst will report to the Data and Systems Quality Manager.

Note: This position is funded for up to 12 months from Date of Hire and will be 100% remote.

Located in Boston and the surrounding communities, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute brings together world renowned clinicians, innovative researchers and dedicated professionals, allies in the common mission of conquering cancer, HIV/AIDS and related diseases. Combining extremely talented people with the best technologies in a genuinely positive environment, we provide compassionate and comprehensive care to patients of all ages; we conduct research that advances treatment; we educate tomorrow's physician/researchers; we reach out to underserved members of our community; and we work with amazing partners, including other Harvard Medical School-affiliated hospitals.

Requirements
Qualifications
B.A. or B.S. or Masters in related field (preferred)
2+ years of experience using Query tools such as SQL and/or SAS (coursework in master's program may be considered)
Data management and/or quality control experience with large data sets, prererably in a medical setting
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with written and verbal English
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to recognize patterns in data
Advanced Excel skills
Excellent communication skills, ability to relate effectively in person and work well in a team
Complex problem solving skills
An ability to work independently
Has a strong understanding of data management processes, and is able to resolve complex issues and questions independently
Dana-Farber Cancer Institute is an equal opportunity employer and affirms the right of every qualified applicant to receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, age, ancestry, military service, protected veteran status, or other groups as protected by law.

POSITION TITLE: Data Analyst

SUPERVISOR'S TITLE: Director of Corporate Integrity/CECO

GENERAL STATEMENT OF RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Data Analyst is responsible for improving service quality and advancing evidence-based practices through use of data collection and analysis. This position works collaboratively with agency managers and directors to assess outcomes, identify opportunities for improvement or areas of concern, and improve program performance. The Data Analyst utilizes traditional and innovative tools and techniques to collect and analyze data and information from internal and external sources, assess why unwanted variation in processes and outcomes exists, and identify how to change or redesign those processes to continually improve the quality and safety of patient care. Additionally, the Data Analyst provides staff with information and educational resources concerning incorporation and benchmarking of industry specific standards and evidence-based practices into program operations.

The Data Analyst serves as the primary coordinator of agency efforts to implement the CQI Plan and serves on all committees and workgroups which oversee projects relevant to the scope of the CQI Plan. The Data Analyst supports the IT Department in appropriately configuring the electronic health record to accurately collect, measure, and report on quality improvement data. The incumbent collaborates with the Internal Audit Department to design and execute strategies to monitor quality indicators and meaningfully analyze and report on quality improvement trends. Utilizing reports from the IT and Internal Audit Departments, the Data Analyst will directly support clinical program management to adjust operations and practices to address identified deficiencies and achieve program specific CQI goals. The position will support other activities within the Corporate Integrity Unit, as needed, to ensure agency compliance with regulatory and industry standards.

QUALIFICATIONS:

The Data Analyst must possess the following formal education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities:

Education and Experience:
Must possess a bachelor’s degree and 3-5 years’ experience in conducting quality and performance improvement activities through use of data analytics. Education and experience conducting data analysis in healthcare settings is preferred. Years of experience may be substituted for specialized training or education in the fields of information analytics, healthcare administration, or behavioral healthcare. Individuals in this position must have excellent skills in the use of information technology and must be capable of managing aspects of the electronic health record database after receiving on the job training in form creation, data mapping, and report writing.

The incumbent should also possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities:

Knowledge of:
• Data analytics
• Program evaluation and outcome measurement
• Database management
• Behavioral health services
• Electronic health records

Skills in:
• Oral, written and interpersonal communications
• Critical thinking and problem solving
• Use of information technology
• Statistical reasoning
• Informal research

Ability to:
• Communicate effectively
• Obtain and integrate knowledge on unfamiliar subject matters
• Collaborate with others on complex projects
• Develop professional quality materials and resources
• Work autonomously within the scope of personal competence and duties of the position
• Maintain accurate files and records

Chase is undertaking an aggressive digital transformation agenda, which builds on the success of the current web and mobile and service offerings. Chase is investing in innovative ways to deepen customer engagement and profitability through the use of digital channels. The ambition is to position Chase as the undisputed leader in digital financial services and payments and to enable Chase to deliver the highly personalized, real time experiences that customers increasingly expect.

Description: Digital Analytics - Data Collection Analyst

Chase Data & Analytics is searching for a Data Collection Analyst who will be a key member of the Data & Analytics organization. As a Data Collection Analyst, you will work as a member of the cross-functional Data & Analytics team partnering with business stakeholders to understand their online initiatives and campaign goals. You will work with the marketers and technical project teams to ensure ad tracking and behavioral tagging within our Digital channels, are created and deployed correctly thereby ensuring data veracity throughout the data collection, transformation and analytic workflows. The successful candidate must also be comfortable troubleshooting data requests, configuring changes on the fly and maintain data integrity within our reporting platforms. We are seeking highly-skilled, passionate, outgoing, and naturally curious candidates that excel in a high-pressure, high-expectation environment paired with an eye for detail, and drive for execution.

Key Responsibilities:
Drive the analytics data collection and measurement efforts by partnering with stakeholders across the enterprise to influence customer focused business results by translating business objectives into feature measurement specifications complete with detailed acceptance criteria
Work with the Web and Mobile behavioral analysis teams to ensure event data is transformed into analytically accessible and valuable data sets that can be joined with attitudinal and structured data to answer critical business questions
Work closely with business solution analysts to review development specifications and identify and resolve tagging/analytics gaps within our Web and Mobile channels
Provide guidance and strategic direction in defining behavioral success metrics, key performance indicators, and specific product engagement metrics
Prioritize data collection enhancements and defects to ensure a timely delivery of current and upcoming initiatives and validate resolutions
Document data collection standards for all new development efforts/site functions.
Provide consistent updates on the status of progress/issues, risks and concerns to digital analytics management.
Qualifications:
5+ years of business analysis experience required, preferably in a financial services environment.
Experience with behavioral / click-stream data (Adobe Analytics, Google 360)
Experience with validating analytics tags (QA) on Web and Mobile.
1+ years working in an agile environment
Experience working with Web and native Mobile app data
Experience working web analytics or tag management projects
Knowledge and application of successful business analysis tools and practices with practical experience
Excellent communication, project management, and client partnership capability.
Proven critical and strategic thinker; ability to understand all available information, synthesize, and communicate a proposed solution clearly and concisely
Proven ability to work in a fast paced environment, meet deadlines, and perform at high standards with limited supervision

Cometeer


Cometeer has developed a revolutionary coffee extraction system that results in what might just be the most flavorful cup of coffee on Earth.

Melting is the new making.

It involves patented machinery we invented ourselves, a fair amount of liquid nitrogen, and beans from the country's best roasters. The result is truly incredible coffee. And we're looking for a few talented folks to help us change the coffee-verse forever.

Data Analyst


As an analyst within the Cometeer organization, you will work across the company, from marketing to finance to operations, to help drive actionable insight, identify complex business challenges and empower smart business decisions.

Responsibilities:
Provide valuable insights through ad-hoc analyses as well as drive long-terms projects and dashboards
Develop key performance metrics for the business, and be in charge of visualization design and implementation
Work cross-functionally with engineering, product, operations, finance and business teams
Influence e-commerce and marketing strategy and prioritization through data
Communicate key findings to leadership and make recommendations around operational efficiencies and product strategies
Help create a culture of data within the organization by mentor team members outside the data organization and helping them drive data-based insights
Manage and guide the work of external data and analytics agencies
Requirements:
3+ years experience in product analytics
Extensive experience and passion for metrics and dashboards visualizations
Preferably experience working in e-commerce related businesses
Highly skilled at writing SQL to query relational databases
Strong communication and presentation skills
Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering)
Love for coffee is a plus!
Who is Cometeer?

Cometeer is a startup coffee technology and manufacturing company. We have developed and patented the first frozen, cryogenically preserved coffee capsule in partnership with the nation's finest roasters. It is driven by a revolutionary extraction system that results in what might just be the most flavorful cup of coffee on Earth, prepared conveniently at home in a fully recyclable and environmentally friendly manner. We believe our product is going to revolutionize the $80+ billion coffee industry. Learn more about us at our website (www.cometeer.com) and in this Fast Company profile.

Why is Cometeer a great place to work?
Dynamic, hyper-growth company with a disruptive product in massive industry
Ability to take on meaningful responsibilities with tons of opportunity for personal growth
Growing, scrappy, and diverse team committed to relentless improvement
Work with visionary young entrepreneurs and top performers from other successful start-ups
Above-market compensation with strong healthcare benefits
Free excellent coffee!
Why is now an exciting time to join Cometeer?

We recently raised over $40 million in Series A financing from established venture capital firms. We are using the proceeds to build out our core team and build our manufacturing facility in Gloucester, Massachusetts, which will increase our production capacity dramatically in the coming months. We have grand ambitions and are looking to hire extraordinary individuals who can get in early and grow their responsibilities alongside the business as we change the coffee-verse forever.

How do I learn more?

See our individual job postings at www.cometeer.com/pages/jobs with links to apply. For general inquiries, email jobs@cometeer.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

Team Benvia

Our mission is to help the world share its risk more intelligently to power a more vibrant economy. To do this, we are transforming insurance distribution and underwriting into a science. We provide entrepreneurial insurance brokers with tools to automatically deliver intelligence-driven experiences to their clients, and it provides insurers and investors with a platform for generating superior returns on large portfolios of risk.

At the core of our operating model is our technology: we're building the premier "AI factory" in the world for risk and applying it at the center of the #1 fastest growing and top-10 largest brokerage in history. By systematically converting data into predictions, insights, and choices, we believe we can remove the constraints associated with scale, scope, and learning that have existed in the insurance industry for centuries.

We operate at the intersection of world class AI talent and seasoned industry expertise. We aren't afraid to challenge conventional wisdom for the benefit of our customers and society, nor do we think we have all the answers. Our culture values first principles thinking, humility, acting boldly, and fresh, heterogeneous perspectives that help us see what others cannot see to transform the industry. We'd like your help.

As a Data Analyst, you'll provide data expertise as we improve the growth, retention, and engagement of our partners and enable them to better serve their customers. You'll collect, organize, and analyze data to create actionable insights that shape strategic decisions, improve our product, and streamline ongoing operations. This role has visibility into the entire company and will work with our product, engineering, marketing, operations and customer support functions to serve our clients. As a successful candidate, you possess a passion for data and for improving techniques, processes, tracking, analytical insights, and technology to achieve our bold goals. You will produce direct and measurable impact while driving a culture of data-driven decision making.

Here are some of the ways in which you'll achieve impact:


Understand product metrics and drive improvements.
Build a deep understanding of our products, data, reporting needs, and key metrics.
Mine data at the customer level to gain a better understanding of their behaviors; provide deep insight and discover opportunities that drive the business.
Analyze the impact of proposed and actual product changes.
Monitor strategic KPIs and understand all underlying drivers.
Collect data from multiple internal and external data sources.
Choose the proper metrics for goal setting and tracking.
Ensure clean data collection with proper governance throughout the data pipeline.
Guide engineering on automation of data pipelines when necessary.
Act as an expert advisor in instrumenting our internal analytics, data warehouse, and other data collection, aggregation, and reporting tools.
Build, maintain, and communicate detailed reporting.
Lead requirements gathering sessions, analyze requirements, design, and develop dashboards and analytical frameworks that support decision making.
Own the communication of outcomes/insights to various stakeholders to aid strategic decisions for improvements to client experience and impact.
Advocate for and identify creative uses of data to answer business-critical questions, as well as solve customer pain points.
Conduct experiments to rigorously measure the impact of product features and process enhancements.
Implement and analyze A/B or multivariate tests to provide actionable insights.
Ensure good experiment design and rigorous identification of factors impacting experiments.
Partner with product, engineering, and marketing to design measurement plans for different activities to drive growth.
Perform pre- and post-campaign analysis to measure the impact of marketing tactics.
Explore data, solve problems, and answer questions.
Explore data to enhance our understanding and identify opportunities for improvements.
Support business users to answer complex business questions.
Be a trusted advisor to Product Management and business leadership.
Collaborate with Product in making product and business decisions based on data insights and experiment results; provide data analysis that drives proactive planning and strategy.
Communicate your methodology and findings to cross-functional peers and management; act as a thought partner to various teams.
You may be fit for this role if you:
Have 3+ years experience as a data analyst, business intelligence analyst, or another data-focused role using advanced analytical methods.
Use data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker and languages such as R and Python to work efficiently and at scale.
Have excellent SQL skills and can maintain a codebase of self-service tools.
Have exposure to running and measuring the results of controlled experiments (A/B testing), with strong knowledge of statistics.
Have a demonstrated aptitude toward data storytelling and root cause analysis using data.
Are committed to learning and love data.
Have strong business acumen and product sense; you are passionate about the product and about transforming the insurance industry.
Are able to deliver on tight timelines and prioritize tasks while maintaining quality and detail.
(Preferred) Possess knowledge in high-growth analytics, advanced marketing analytics methods, or product operations experience.
(Preferred) Prior exposure to the insurance industry.
Are entrepreneurial and action-biased; self-directed and excited to build something from scratch in a fast-paced, experimentation-driven environment.
Possess empathy, kindness towards others, a positive attitude, and self-awareness.
Bring a unique, non-traditional perspective to enhance our team's problem solving abilities.
Have a Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field that emphasizes data (e.g., computer science, economics, math, engineering, or statistics), or equivalent work experience.
Are willing and able to work from the headquarters in Austin, Texas (preferred), with remote roles considered for the right candidate.
It's not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas. If you are a solid Analyst and eager to work on data- or insurance-related platforms/products, we are eager to talk to you.

We are looking for an organized, detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our Operations team. You will be responsible for collecting, maintaining, and analyzing data that drives our day to day business as well as translating data into insights and working closely with our leadership to help guide our business strategy.

Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will:

• Collect data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.

• Utilize strong Microsoft Excel and SQL skills to provide high-quality data analysis.

• Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports that effectively communicate trends, patterns and predictions using relevant data.

• Manage and complete time-sensitive monthly data tracking and reporting projects.

• Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

• Fix coding errors investigate data anomalies and other data-related problems.

• Assist in building predictive systems to help catch issues before they arise and assist in building and supporting monthly financial reporting.

• Own the design of advanced analytics dashboards and KPI reports in our BI tool starting from requirements gathering across sales, product, and senior leadership teams to the delivery of a final, polished reports in production.

• Use data to answer key questions about the business and deliver takeaways from data with statistical significance.

• Provide timely, valuable solutions for ad hoc analyses via SQL with a focus to detail on crafting scripts that can be easily manipulated to efficiently address similar future analyses.

• Be the go-to person for any ad-hoc data-related questions.

Skills

• 2-5 years of experience in data, consulting, analytics, or a related function involving quantitative data analysis to solve problems.

• Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

• Proficiency in using SQL and advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.

• Experience designing reports and dashboards with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Microsoft Power BI.

• Experience with using an ETL management tool to collect data from various sources into analytical databases.

• Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.

• Data-oriented personality, great communication skills, and an excellent eye for details.

• Accountability is key needs to have drive, urgency and be self-motivated.

• BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics is a plus.

OUR VISION: THE WORLD. SUBSCRIBED.

Customers have changed. They're looking for new ways to engage with businesses. Consumers today have a new set of expectations. They want outcomes, not ownership. Customization, not generalization. Constant improvement, not planned obsolescence.

In the old world (let's call it the Product Economy) it was all about things. Acquiring new customers, shipping commodities, billing for one-time transactions. But in today's new era, it's all about relationships. More and more customers are becoming subscribers because subscription experiences built around services meet consumers' needs better than the static offerings or a single product.

Our vision is "The World Subscribed" where one day every company will be a part of the Subscription Economy® (a phrase coined by our CEO, Tien Tzuo and author of the best selling book Subscribed).

THE TEAM

At Zuora, data is a key strategic pillar for operating our business. All our teams rely on accurate, timely data to measure and improve outcomes, including building better products, improving the customer experience, optimizing the sales process, and ultimately increasing the overall value we deliver to our customers.

The Zuora Corporate Data Team drives the overall vision of a "Company Powered by Data". The team's mission is to enable all other teams to manage and use data effectively to make better decisions, by providing high-quality datasets, self-service tools and guidance. We strive to maintain a product focus and treat other teams as our customers.

YOUR MISSION: To build and support high-quality data sets and reporting and analytics tools for internal customers.

THE OPPORTUNITY (AKA: Why you want this role over any other out there)

As a Data and Product Analyst on the Zuora Corporate Data Team, you'll have the opportunity to expand your skills in multiple directions, including data analytics, product management, and project management:
Computing metrics and KPIs related to corporate finances, internal processes and product usage, to help executives track the state of the business is real time
Curating a shared corporate data model that helps all teams to foster collaboration and communication about customers, products and end-to-end processes
Working with engineers to implement continuous monitoring and validation of data quality
Working with the team and with end users to design effective reports and visualizations for a wide variety of use cases
OUR DATA STACK: AWS, Python, SQL, Postgres, BI tools, custom internal applications

WHAT YOU'LL ACHIEVE

As a Data and Product Analyst, advancing your career depends on much more than your ability to solve isolated technical problems. Joining the Corporate Zuora Data Team will also give you the opportunity to develop the whole range of skills you need to scale your effectiveness as a product builder and organizational leader:
Working directly with end users in a variety of different roles to understand business requirements and identify appropriate technical solutions
Writing design and implementation documentation
Running a transparent, predictable product delivery lifecycle, including planning, testing and release management
Successful candidates for this position should be able to demonstrate a solid foundation as data analysts, aptitude for building data products, excellent communication skills, and a strong desire to learn. Desirable previous experience includes:
management consulting
building data products (such as the analytics features of a business application) for external customers
supporting internal customers as part of a BI or data team
performing the role of technical business analyst on a finance, sales, marketing or "growth" team

Full Time Data Analyst (Digital Outreach)*
AlphaVu is a Washington, D.C. based analytics and outreach company that specializes in social listening, data mining, and machine learning for clients in the public transportation and infrastructure, public health, industry association, legislative, and policy industry arenas. Our analytic outlook is focused on social network analysis as a methodology aimed at creating growing, stable governing and business coalitions, rather than relying on outdated, reductionist market segmentation methodologies. Our techniques, combined with our real-world understanding of how people communicate and share information, empowers us to help our clients and partners deliver winning and unifying messages.
_AlphaVu’s Task at Hand_*
AlphaVu is quickly growing in the public transportation, infrastructure, and public health areas. We work closely with our clients in these industries to develop and implement outreach strategies based on analytic insights. AlphaVu is currently seeking a data analyst to produce client reports, manage digital outreach campaigns, and contribute to AlphaVu’s technological and analytic development. AlphaVu is also beginning to assist state governments in online contact tracing efforts.
_Job Description_*
Our new Data Analyst will work with us to create and deliver analytic reports to our clients. This skill requires the ability to quickly synthesize information within evolving strategic frameworks. It also requires superior communications skills, including the ability to write clearly and succinctly, speak publicly, and generate visual representations of complex ideas.

We also expect the Data Analyst to assist in client communication campaigns as needed and to become familiar with implementing online digital outreach campaigns. This includes creating targeted audiences and setting ad placements using insights gleaned from market data.

The Data Analyst will love working with and writing about analytics, all while helping to improve analytic frameworks that improve client and organizational decision making. A grounding in basis statistics is very helpful for this work.

AlphaVu is a small but growing company. Team members should feel comfortable working in a small office setting (and remotely as public health guidelines demand). Candidates should be able to manage work independently, enthusiastically contribute to team projects, and be adaptable to the immediate needs of a small business.

Collect and analyze social data from online platforms and AlphaVu’s proprietary data analytics software.
Manage and segment large datasets using basic R or Python code.
Synthesize large amounts of information into well-written reports and client presentations.
Create and maintain client dashboards and visualizations using Tableau.
Provide high-level customer support and communication for clients across our industries.
Develop and implement digital outreach and strategic communication campaigns, including ad-supported placements.
Understand and be able to use social media and search engine metrics in order to build and manage audiences.
Assist in the planning and production of social media content and blog posts for both AlphaVu and our clients.
Work with AlphaVu software engineers on our ongoing systems development processes.
_Required Qualifications_*
Bachelor’s degree in the social sciences, economics, statistics, public policy, or a related field.
Up to 3 years of relevant work and/or research experience.
Demonstrated understanding of social media advertising placement and search advertising.
Demonstrated understanding of social media performance analytics.
Expertise in the use of Excel.
Proficiency in R.
Ability to work both independently and in teams as required.
Passion for pitching in and working across boundaries and narrowly defined rolls in a small and growing company.
Very self-motivated, highly organized, pays attention to detail, and able to quickly master new skills and techniques.
Proficiency with Tableau and Tableau Server.
_Preferred Qualifications_*
Basic proficiency in Python programming language.
Understanding of machine learning concepts.
Experience with natural language processing on social media data.
Familiarity with Elastic Search and Kibana.

50% healthcare premium based on bronze reference plan.
Public transit compensation of $85/month.

Job Description:
Program Specialist II

Program Specialist II
HHSC is seeking a Data Analyst to join an interdisciplinary team of professionals who support the 13 State Supported Living Centers (SSLC) across Texas. As a Data Analyst, you will work with a dynamic group of staff who are dedicated to providing supports and services for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. This is a team environment where staff members collaborate to provide comprehensive care and services in a fast-paced environment, and rely upon data to ensure optimal results. To learn more about the SSLCs, see https://hhs.texas.gov/services/disability/intellectual-or-developmental-disabilities-idd-long-term-care. The State of Texas offers many benefits to employees, including competitive salaries, career advancement, health and dental insurance, and paid vacation and sick leave.

The data analyst is responsible for providing oversight and guidance to program staff in the collection, review, and validation of electronic health data required for tracking and trending quality of care. This includes the development and maintenance of management tools and reports associated with an electronic health record and the data required for advancing the state’s quality improvement efforts and service monitoring. The position requires the use of relational database management systems, including the development of queries, and report development software to gather, review, and analyze data. The position also involves working with program staff to ensure data integrity. Work involves conducting complex and detailed analysis of and extensive research on data and reporting results. Other duties include responding to ad hoc data requests. The data analyst also serves as the liaison with state office data analysts. The ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team is essential. The position works under limited direction with significant latitude and independence.

Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular basis and may be required to work a specific shift schedule or, at times, even a rotating schedule, extended shift, and/or overtime in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

Designs and maintains administrative reports using data from an electronic health record and internal monitoring tools and databases.

Writes queries to access data for analysis and reporting.

Maintains a relational database system and spreadsheets to track and trend quality of care data.

Develops and implements tools to track the accuracy and integrity of data reporting.

Establishes processes for analyzing and validating data used to calculate outcome measures.

Works with interdisciplinary teams to research and correct data issues.

Acts as a liaison with state office data analysts and HHSC IT.

Assists in identifying and interpreting data patterns and trends.

Responds to ad hoc data requests and/or submissions to State Office.

Conducts frequent audits using reports to verify information entered into the electronic health record is accurate.

Other duties as assigned include, but are not limited to, actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.

Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Skill managing data in a relational database management system, including the development of queries, and report development software.
Skill in the use of computers and applicable software in conducting data searches and data cleaning.
Skill in the proficient use of MS Excel including formulas.
Skill in critical thinking.
Ability to gather, review, and analyze data.
Ability to maintain accuracy and attention to detail.
Ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines.
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
Ability and willingness to learn new systems.
Ability and willingness to be a team player and work well with a variety of stakeholders.
Knowledge, or ability to gain knowledge, of agency programs, policies, and service delivery processes.
Registration or Licensure Requirements:
None

Initial Selection Criteria:
Some college/university level coursework in data science, business analytics, computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, accounting, finance, mathematics, statistics, economics, or a related field is generally preferred.
Experience in data analysis, research, and report design.
Experience in designing, developing, and maintaining queries and reports.
Experience working with electronic health records is strongly preferred.

Summary: The Financial Sales Data Analyst will be working closely with the Director of Finance and will be responsible for providing financial and analytical functions to support Sales and Marketing teams. This person will be able to work a fast-paced and rapidly growing and changing environment and will gain exposure to NetSuite, Tableau, SQL and Advanced Excel. The Financial Sales Data Analyst will provide operational solutions/analyses to maximize sales force efficiencies and promote revenue/market share growth in a data driven environment. Overall, the primary responsibilities include sales and marketing analytics; incentive compensation reporting and administration; business intelligence system administration; pricing and contracting analysis, etc.

Job Duties:
Analyze data and develop programs, methodologies, dashboards, and files in order to measure and report on the performance of the sales function.

Work directly with I.T. resources to configure and administer ERP platform (NetSuite) to better meet the needs of the commercial organization.

Keep company leaders to date on the status of issues and analysis, including known problems being worked and perceived risks.
Monitor data and system rules to ensure integrity sales data, customer accounts and sales team data.
Perform business analysis functions including documenting processes, gathering business requirements to support company strategies, and identifying CRM improvements to support processes within sales.
Improve productivity by evaluating and recommending and implementing new sales technologies.
Help sales leaders make data-driven decisions.

Job no: 495633 Work type: Regular Full-Time Location: Bethesda, MD Capability Area: Business Ventures and Innovation

JOB DESCRIPTION:

NORC at the University of Chicago is seeking a Data Analyst on our BEAD team. At NORC, Data Analysts work with our Data Scientists, and play a strategic role in supporting our research teams to produce valuable insights for our clients. They work collaboratively and help break down silos and barriers across the company to help drive innovative work. Under the leadership of Data Scientists, the Data Analysts contribute to the design and implementation of algorithms, models, and work flows to discover valuable information in large volumes of data from various sources; organizes, harmonizes, and analyzes data sets; uses various technologies to enable data visualization; and creates applications of general value to the company’s business.

Due to current COVID-19 safety measures, employees who can work from home, are required to do so. Once it is safe to resume standard practices of commuter travel and social interaction per government guidelines, we expect employees to maintain an office presence as required by projects needs and department leadership. This position in particular will be on-site at a Federal client several days a week once it is safe.

DEPARTMENT:

The Behavioral and Economic Analysis and Decision-Making (BEAD) team at NORC provides clients with actionable insights on critical policy and business issues. Applying rigorous, state-of-the-art methods from the fields of consumer behavior, judgment and decision-making, behavioral finance, household economics, cognitive science, experimental methods, and statistical analysis, BEAD obtains fact-based empirical evidence and distills the results into comprehensive, understandable, and usable reports and recommendations.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Gathering results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to moderate to complex data mining.
Support the presentation of data by developing charts, graphs and tables.
Under close supervision, maintains databases/data systems, data dictionaries, etc.
Perform other duties as assigned.

REQUIRED SKILLS:
Bachelor's Degree in Math, Statistics, or Economics.
0 - 2 years experience in positions working with large datasets and conducting statistical and quantitative modeling, melding analytics with basic programming, data mining, clustering and segmentation. Domain expertise preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication including technical writing skills.
Basic data programming skills in statistical packages and database tools. Proficiency in R required.

WHAT WE DO:

NORC at the University of Chicago is an objective, non-partisan research institution that delivers reliable data and rigorous analysis to guide critical programmatic, business, and policy decisions. Since 1941, our teams have conducted groundbreaking studies, created and applied innovative methods and tools, and advanced principles of scientific integrity and collaboration. Today, government, corporate, and nonprofit clients around the world partner with us to transform increasingly complex information into useful knowledge.

WHO WE ARE:

For over 75 years, NORC has evolved in many ways, moving the needle with research methods, technical applications and groundbreaking research findings. But our tradition of excellence, passion for innovation, and commitment to collegiality have remained constant components of who we are as a brand, and who each of us is as a member of the NORC team. With world-class benefits, a business casual environment, and an emphasis on continuous learning, NORC is a place where people join for the stellar research and analysis work for which we’re known, and stay for the relationships they form with their colleagues who take pride in the impact their work is making on a global scale.

EEO STATEMENT:

NORC is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer that values and actively seeks diversity in the workforce. NORC evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and other legally- protected characteristics.

As a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, our reach is global and our impact is profound. Join our acclaimed team and discover how your talents can change lives. Yours included.

The Kronos Workforce Planning Analyst will be responsible for:

Interpreting data trends and statistical variances to inform enterprise perspective on workforce changes.
Assisting with presentation of reports, gathering qualitative data from leaders, and providing recommendations.
Creating, reviewing, and distributing regularly scheduled and ad hoc reports to leaders, ensuring data integrity and on-time delivery.

Continually review the reporting processes to ensure efficient delivery of data

Ability to collaborate with cross functional teams and levels.
Ability to effectively communicate outputs of data analysis and provide insights to a broad audience (i.e., senior executives, department managers, peer analysts).

Summary:
Eprine Community Services seeks a highly motivated individual to work in our behavioral health department:
The Intake/Data Analyst, analyzes and presents data in a variety of formats for a variety of audiences, including developing reports, presentations and other documents. This position is integral and work collaboratively with other team members to obtain and manage data and produce statistical analyses. A key priority is to prepare reports and presentations that inform ongoing activities across the organization to monitor and improve the quality of services delivered by the agency. The Data Analyst also researches publicly available data relevant to Eprine’s priorities and initiatives and incorporates it into analyses and presentations to inform planning and monitoring activities. .
Duties and Responsibilities:
1. The Data Analyst is responsible for the installation, configuration, upgrade, administration, monitoring, and maintenance of department database(s). The position includes the development and design of the database to support the credentialing, privileging, and provider enrollment activities within the department.
2. The database analyst will continually improve the database performance and capacity in order to improve department processes and plan for future expansions as required.
3. Administers, maintains, and implements the policies and procedures needed to ensure the security and integrity of the database.
4. Serves as the Project Manager for any project necessary to maintain and expand the credentialing database and any new databases/applications obtained to support the functions and activities of the department.
5. Participate in data-related projects, including data normalization, data maintenance, data research, data standardization, data product development, and data quality assurance. Coordinate with Managers and Case Managers on Treatment plans
6. Work with Department head on Case assignments
7. Perform data management tasks, including data checking and cleaning, creation and maintenance of data dictionaries for datasets, merging data and creating and recording variables to prepare data for analyses.
8. Serve as part of any team as needed, in any capacity that is needed.
9. Assesses gaps and deficiencies in processes and workflows, report them and work with stakeholders to implement optimizations and changes to the system, processes, and workflows.
10. Assists staff in exporting data for various reports and programs.
11. Provides feedback, analysis and guidance regarding agency initiatives, optimizations and efficiency improvements.
12. Work with teams across the organization in achieving Meaningful Use and Client related information.
13. Running various reports, comparing data, providing feedback and forecasting, comparing and contrasting data to understand trends, areas for improvements, deficiencies, and current status of information.
14. Attend and present at meetings with the various issues, status reports, and modifications needed. As well as feedback from staff regarding issues and optimizations needed to improve data.
15. Assisting departments as needed. Including creating cheat sheets, workflows, and other data related tools to understand problems and implement improvements.
16. Implement a Data Reporting strategy to include, Data Trend Analysis, Ad-hoc reporting and Data-Driven projects.
17. Providing remote support to and resolving issues as they arise.
18. Performs other related duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:
· Strong Project Management experience
· Strong information technology knowledge and skills, E H R a plus
· Microsoft Suite (Excel and Database set up especially)
· Knowledge of PC and Mac IT capabilities
· Experience in database management and design
· Extensive knowledge of working in database tables
· Experience planning and executing major system projects
· It is preferable to have a Bachelor’s Degree

Pay: $20.00 per hour
Benefits:

Health insurance

Paid time off

8 hour shift

Job Title: Lead Analyst Data Science, Large Scale Data
Job Description:
ASU Job Title
Lead Analyst Data Science

16-Nov-2020

Department Name
Complex Adaptive Systems

Campus/Location
Off-Campus: Scottsdale

Job Description

Under senior administrative direction of the Deputy Director the Lead Analyst Data Science for Remote Sensing will be responsible for managing, planning, supporting and preparing data analysis and reports focused on the focus topic assigned. The data generated will be used for business decision-making, strategic planning, and process improvement to support the growth of the ASU-UA Collaboration Institute for Future Health (IFH). The area of advanced analytic techniques, including but not limited to program management of artificial intelligence tool development, machine learning methods, neural networks and advanced bioinformatics tool development to support remote sensing capabilities.

Knowledge of principles and practices pertaining to artificial intelligence tool development and machine learning as it applies to the practice of medicine. Ability to evaluate the development of advanced analytic tool technology and to identify analytic tools that have the greatest potential impact on future healthcare. To work with university scientists developing advanced analytic tools to explore new health related applications for analytic methods. Deep knowledge of the artificial intelligence and machine learning industrial research. Knowledge of advanced analytic methods and tools currently available for healthcare applications, methods and tools that are currently available for non-healthcare applications.

Requisition ID
64137BR

Working Environment

Activities are performed in an environmentally controlled office setting subject to extended periods of sitting, keyboarding and manipulating a computer mouse; required to stand for varying lengths of time and walk moderate distances to perform work. Occasional bending, reaching, lifting, pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds. Regular activities require ability to quickly change priorities, which may include and/or are subject to resolution of conflicts. Ability to clearly communicate to perform essential functions.

Background Check Statement
ASU conducts pre-employment screening for all positions which includes a criminal background check, verification of work history, academic credentials, licenses, and certifications. Employment is contingent upon successful passing of the background check.

Minimum Qualifications

Ph.D. in Statistics, Computer Information Systems, Business Information or a related field and five (5) years of related administrative/data analysis experience which includes one (1) year of supervisory experience, OR, any equivalent combination of experience and/or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved.

Department Statement
For the sixth year in a row, ASU has been named the most innovative school in the nation, recognizing the university's culture of groundbreaking research and partnerships, as well as its commitment to helping students thrive in college and beyond. U.S. News and World Report has named ASU as the most innovative university all six years the category has existed.

ASU Knowledge Enterprise advances research, innovation, strategic partnerships, entrepreneurship, and international development. Our success arises from solutions-focused, interdisciplinary research; an entrepreneurial approach that is embedded in every school and department; and a commitment to transform society in a positive way. http://research.asu.edu/

Category
03

VP Code
KNOWLEDGE ENTERPRISE DEV

Scope of Search
Open

Desired Qualifications
Demonstrated knowledge of principles and practices pertaining to the development of advanced analysis methods and technology, in particular artificial intelligence, machine learning, neural networks and other advanced bioinformatics analytic tools related to analyzing and integrating a variety of data types for healthcare purposes. Such datasets could include remote sensing technology, genomic information, electronic health records and imaging technologies.
Demonstrated knowledge of analysis techniques and reporting strategies
Demonstrated knowledge of computing and data analysis
Demonstrated knowledge of data management and information technologies
Demonstrated knowledge of supervisory principles practices and techniques
Demonstrated knowledge of the principles of exemplary customer service demonstrated through actively listening, acknowledging, and responding to every inquiry; taking ownership and resolving each concern or problem as appropriate; exhibiting professionalism and expertise in every interaction and engaging in professional development to meet expectations for service excellence.
Experience in quantitative data analysis and interpretation.
Demonstrated knowledge of the principles and practices pertaining to the assigned department
Demonstrated knowledge of administrative, financial, and business management principles and practices
Experience in collecting, organizing, synthesizing and analyzing data; summarizing findings; developing conclusions and recommendations
Experience in planning, analyzing, and coordinating activities and establishing priorities
Experience in managing multiple priorities, adhering to deadlines and allocating
Experience in accurately and reliably interpret data for determining appropriate action
Experience in influencing changes in individual, institutional, and/or corporate behaviors to create a more sustainable environment
Experience in communicating results of analysis, novel ideas and project updates to senior management, peers and collaborators
Experience in designing, building and maintaining databases of information related to the development of advanced analytic tools by external companies and university scientists.
Demonstrated knowledge of the importance of metadata as it applies to development of advanced analysis methods and technology.
Close Date
07-December-2020

Grant Funded Position
This is not a grant funded position and is not contingent on future grant funding.

ASU Statement

Arizona State University is a new model for American higher education, an unprecedented combination of academic excellence, entrepreneurial energy and broad access. This New American University is a single, unified institution comprising four differentiated campuses positively impacting the economic, social, cultural and environmental health of the communities it serves. Its research is inspired by real world application blurring the boundaries that traditionally separate academic disciplines. ASU serves more than 80,000 students in metropolitan Phoenix, Arizona, the nation's fifth largest city. ASU champions intellectual and cultural diversity, and welcomes students from all fifty states and more than one hundred nations across the globe.

ASU is a tobacco-free university. For details visit www.asu.edu/tobaccofree

AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni are encouraged to apply.

Arizona State University is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor and an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by law.

Notice of Availability of the ASU Annual Security and Fire Safety Report
In compliance with federal law, ASU prepares an annual report on campus security and fire safety programs and resources. ASU’s Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is available online at https://www.asu.edu/police/PDFs/ASU-Clery-Report.pdf. You may request a hard copy of the report by contacting the ASU Police Department at 480-965-3456.

Relocation Assistance – For information about schools, housing child resources, neighborhoods, hospitals, community events, and taxes, visit https://cfo.asu.edu/relocation-services.

Full-Time/Part-Time
Full-Time

Essential Duties

Knowledge of principles and practices pertaining to artificial intelligence tool development and machine learning as it applies to the practice of medicine. Ability to evaluate the development of advanced analytic tool technology and to identify analytic tools that have the greatest potential impact on future healthcare. To work with university scientists developing advanced analytic tools to explore new health related applications for analytic methods. Deep knowledge of the artificial intelligence and machine learning industrial research. Knowledge of advanced analytic methods and tools currently available for healthcare applications, methods and tools that are currently available for non-healthcare applications.

Performs data analysis, to understand current performance, analyze trends, and to make recommendations for future project performance related to advanced analytic methods and technology. Develops measurements and metrics for data analysis to be used for business decision-making, planning, and process improvement. Securely collects, cleanses, standardize, transforms and stores data from various sources ensuring data integrity. Directs the collection of supplier data (e.g. industry trends, supplier performance and cost dynamics); prepares supplier reviews. Uses predictive modeling, statistics, trend analysis and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, and identify the right data to be analyzed from internal and external sources. In collaboration with other data scientists in the Institute, creates and maintains statistical reporting tools to support the specific discipline. Responsible for regularly auditing data input; audits may involve studying number, organization practices and customer feedback. Prepares or coordinates preparation of reports; analyzes and interprets statistics, financial data, and management planning data for predicting resource needs and developing long range plans. Prepares presentations to stakeholders and university administration. Conducts and assists with the development of long-and short-range goals. Represents the department/college and serves on various department and university committees. Maintains broad awareness of current trends in data collection and organization, data preservation, and numeric data analysis by participation in appropriate professional activities and contributing to research in the field. Will implement procedures and technologies that assure the long-term sustainability and accessibility of datasets. May supervise, monitor or coordinate the activities of subordinates to ensure adherence with stated outcomes, timeframes and standards. Reviews job performance in conjunction with established unit, department and university goals. Utilizes various computer programs and software to perform data computation, statistical analysis and other data manipulation activities. May perform other duties as assigned.

Employment Verification Statement
ASU conducts pre-employment screening which may include verification of work history, academic credentials, licenses, and certifications.

Salary Range
Depends on experience

Instructions to Apply

Application deadline is 3:00PM Arizona time on the date indicated.

Please include all employment information in month/year format (e.g., 6/88 to 8/94), job title, job duties and name of employer for each position.

Resume should clearly illustrate how prior knowledge and experience meets the Minimum and Desired qualifications of this position.

ASU does not pay for travel expenses associated with interviews, unless otherwise indicated.

Only electronic applications are accepted for this position.

IMPORTANT NOTE: What is the meaning of “equivalent combination” in the minimum qualifications? It means one year of higher education or 24 credit hours, is equal to one year of experience. For example, a four year Bachelor’s degree is equal to four years of experience.

Essential Duties

Knowledge of principles and practices pertaining to artificial intelligence tool development and machine learning as it applies to the practice of medicine. Ability to evaluate the development of advanced analytic tool technology and to identify analytic tools that have the greatest potential impact on future healthcare. To work with university scientists developing advanced analytic tools to explore new health related applications for analytic methods. Deep knowledge of the artificial intelligence and machine learning industrial research. Knowledge of advanced analytic methods and tools currently available for healthcare applications, methods and tools that are currently available for non-healthcare applications.

Performs data analysis, to understand current performance, analyze trends, and to make recommendations for future project performance related to advanced analytic methods and technology. Develops measurements and metrics for data analysis to be used for business decision-making, planning, and process improvement. Securely collects, cleanses, standardize, transforms and stores data from various sources ensuring data integrity. Directs the collection of supplier data (e.g. industry trends, supplier performance and cost dynamics); prepares supplier reviews. Uses predictive modeling, statistics, trend analysis and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, and identify the right data to be analyzed from internal and external sources. In collaboration with other data scientists in the Institute, creates and maintains statistical reporting tools to support the specific discipline. Responsible for regularly auditing data input; audits may involve studying number, organization practices and customer feedback. Prepares or coordinates preparation of reports; analyzes and interprets statistics, financial data, and management planning data for predicting resource needs and developing long range plans. Prepares presentations to stakeholders and university administration. Conducts and assists with the development of long-and short-range goals. Represents the department/college and serves on various department and university committees. Maintains broad awareness of current trends in data collection and organization, data preservation, and numeric data analysis by participation in appropriate professional activities and contributing to research in the field. Will implement procedures and technologies that assure the long-term sustainability and accessibility of datasets. May supervise, monitor or coordinate the activities of subordinates to ensure adherence with stated outcomes, timeframes and standards. Reviews job performance in conjunction with established unit, department and university goals. Utilizes various computer programs and software to perform data computation, statistical analysis and other data manipulation activities. May perform other duties as assigned.

Description :

Hello Everyone,

I am looking for "Analytics Manager" for one of my top client. If you are looking for a job change and interested in new opportunities. Please go over below and apply.

Title: Analytical Manager

Duration: 6 - 8 months contract to hire
Location: Austin, TX- Remote now, planning to go in the office around Feb or March

Day to day:
In the beginning, the team is going to be 6 people, but the team is always growing. The team Will grow up to 10-11 people. Could be a mix of existing people that have the advanced skills + additional contractors to report up to the person.
The manager will Jump in and do the job at the modern space-age level. This person will have to come in and lead by example.
Communication skills are extremely important. Analysts have challenges to properly articulate what they have found in a PowerPoint, need to be able to tell a story, want to avoid people that are over-talkers, extremely direct. Don’t need all the reasoning.
They are going to be managing the team by producing the work that they need thru root cause analysts. Will be interacting with client success managers to approve intakes. The CSM will come to them with a request to try and tell them how to do analysis instead of asking what the problem is. Navigate these conversations with logic and push back.
They will be interacting with peers as well. Need to be able to present to upper-level management. The interaction will include 1x a month where they will be interacting with them. boss makes quick judgments, they need to make sure they are very sharp and can get things done quickly.
They must be able to organize work, manage chaos and complexity. This team gets a lot of last-second requests, need to be able to handle pressure on the spot.

Must-Have:
Sr. Manager level experience/ If not interested in moving to management
3+ years of call center background & experience OR Have supported call center customers for 3 years
Been doing analytical work prior to being a manage themselves
Advanced level MS Excel skills – Macros, Pivot Tables, H-Look Ups, V-Looks Ups -Will be manipulating data in excel
Moderate to Advanced level SQL experience- Navigate data sets, merge, joins
Moderate to Advanced Tableau experience- Use it to do visualization to analyze data and dissect the info
Tableau dashboard to explain what’s happening – screenshot to go to PowerPoint
Moderate Python Scripting experience OR other similar scripting experience

Thanks

The Support Temp, Head Start Data will report to the Manager, Head Start Performance.

• Performing periodic extraction, transformation and upload of student demographic, eligibility and attendance data • Provide database access to new staff including setting up appropriate permissions • Troubleshoot daily staff access and other database issues • Assist Data Specialist in developing, formatting and distributing data reports to stakeholders including monthly Enrollment, Attendance, and Registration reports and other ad hoc reporting needs • Perform regular data quality assurance for student and staff data • Assist the Data Specialist in preparation and production of annual PIR report • Assist Data Specialist in documentation of all ECE data process and procedures

Dependability: Does whatever it takes to consistently deliver with high quality under tight deadlines; successfully manages own projects through strong organization, detailed workplans, and balancing of multiple priorities. Communication and Customer Service Skills: Communicates clearly and compellingly with diverse stakeholders in both oral and written forms; anticipates and responds to customer needs in a high-quality and courteous manner.

Description:
The Data Analyst will be responsible for discovering analytics and system integrations requirements,
identifying data sources and criteria needed, documenting specs for developers, testing the output, and
ensuring user acceptance. This position will work directly with internal customers, business process owners, leadership, Business Analysts, and BI, ETL, and Webservices Developers.

The ideal candidate has proven working experience taking a vaguely stated business question and unpacking it into specific requirements, data sources, and criteria. The skillset is a cross between a business analyst working with the customer on requirements discovery and a "data detective" identifying and interpreting data using SQL and analysis skills. Analytical /conceptual/ curious/ problem-solving mindset is an absolute must. Experience writing SQL against complex tables containing historical/future data is a must. Working knowledge of HR data and processes (esp. PeopleSoft HCM data) is strongly preferred. Selected candidates will be expected to walk through their data gathering, analysis, and SQL experience in detail.

Job Responsibilities:
• Analyze large volumes of complex data that requires consideration of multiple factors to interpret the
• information
• Work closely with stakeholders to understand the business process and turn vague one-liner requests into
• detailed, testable requirements that meet the business needs
• Propose and implement analytics solutions to support business needs and data-driven decisions
• Support new system implementation projects, including data feeds, data design, and mapping
• Identify and document data sources, criteria, and data mapping
• Develop subject matter expertise and understand dependencies between source systems
• Use SQL to explore, extract, and analyze data, including historical data
• Assess data quality and completeness and implement solutions to ensure accurate reporting
• Propose solutions to collect new data points to support metrics and identify trends
• Design reports/dashboard layouts to present data in a clean, consumable, and insightful format
• Write report and data feed specifications for BI, ETL, and Webservices Developers
• Receive and prioritize requests for reports
• Assist customers with ad-hoc reporting needs
• Audit existing reports and propose improvements for findability of data
• Serve as a resource to Business Analysts and Developers for data-related needs
• Support development of other team members' data analysis skills though knowledge share
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Finance, or related field
• 3-4 years performing data analysis
• 3-4 years as a business analyst (working with stakeholders on requirements and business process)
• 2-3 years of experience writing complex SQL queries
• Above average analytical and conceptual thinking; resourceful problem-solving
• Fascination with data, desire to learn new concepts, finds business process and data analysis rewarding
• Expert level SQL skills; experience writing complex queries with multiple table joins, subqueries, and
• historical data
• Basic knowledge of database design principles, deep understanding of relational databases
• Familiarity with data warehouse, data mart, ETL, and webservices concepts
• Exposure to reporting tools and some hands-on experience building reports
• Advanced Excel skills (formulas, charts, pivot tables)
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Experience communicating with all levels in the organization in a clear and concise manner using non-
• technical language
• Excellent documentation skills
• Attention to detail and accuracy
• Strong experience working with HR data and processes
• Process analysis skills
• Ability to lead others to articulate requirements and uncover hidden needs
• Familiarity with SDLC
• Experience managing multiple requests and projects
• Adaptability to changing requests and priorities
• Experience with PeopleSoft HCM data
• Eye for aesthetics and usability in report design
• Data visualization experience, such as dashboards
• Familiarity with statistical methods
• Predictive analytics/forecasting experience
• 1-2 years of BI experience working with Cognos, Tableau, or similar BI suites
• Strong presentation skills
**Only US Citizens will be considered for this position. Local candidates strongly preferred***
Required / Desired Skills
Experience performing data analysis (Required 3 Years)

Experience as a business analyst (working with stakeholders on requirements and business process) (Required 3 Years)

Experience writing complex SQL queries; • Expert level SQL skills; experience writing complex queries with multiple table joins (Required 3 Years)

Strong analytical and conceptual thinking; resourceful problem-solver (Required 2 Years)

Basic knowledge of database design principles, deep understanding of relational databases (Required 2 Years)

Familiarity with data warehouse, data mart, ETL, and webservices concepts (Required 2 Years)

Exposure to reporting tools and some hands-on experience building reports (Required 2 Years)

BI experience working with Cognos, Tableau, or similar BI suites (Required 2 Years)

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Finance, or related field (Required 4 Years)

U.S. News & World Report is a digital first media company dedicated to helping consumers and business professionals make important decisions. We publish independent reporting, rankings, data journalism and advice that has earned the trust of our readers and users for more than 85 years.

As a trusted authority providing empowerment and guidance that improves the quality of life for consumers and communities, U.S. News ultimately leads to better life decisions.

Your role in helping us shape the future:

As a member of the U.S. News Money team, you will be involved in supporting the Money product team to help drive the future of our business; you will be a key member of a fast-growing organization that is goal-oriented and re-shaping our future.

The primary responsibilities of the Data Analyst will be to ensure rankings data quality in a timely manner.

Are you up to the challenge?

Collect and analyze data for Money rankings, including fielding surveys

Develop expertise in ranking methodologies and data sources

Develop quality assurance procedures for data collected internally and from third party sources; ensuring accuracy of rankings computations and information displayed on usnews.com

Coordinate closely with U.S. News technical team on the development efforts related to rankings launches; providing detailed written specs, assisting in troubleshooting bugs, and testing the accuracy of data loads

Analysis tasks may include computing scores on ranking factors, modeling impact of potential methodology changes, performing multiple regression analyses, testing for statistical outliers and producing data visualizations

Meet specific project deadlines and timelines set by the product management and tech teams

Provide editorial and PR team with data used in articles, short lists, and slideshows as well as assist in the review process prior to publication

Recommend new methodologies and product features based upon data analysis

On-going data and product QA, with detailed-oriented eye for errors/ bugs

You should definitely have:

Bachelor’s degree in data science or a related field or equivalent experience

3+ years relevant work experience

High level proficiency working in MS Office Suite, specifically in Excel

Knowledge of database structures and experience writing SQL select statements to query databases

Strong oral and written communication skills

Excelled in college-level quantitative coursework (economics, math, statistics or computer science)

Attention to detail, excellent organizational skills and strong time management skills

It would be nice if you had:

Experience in JIRA

Up-to-date knowledge on Internet publishing and metrics, with an acute understanding of SEO, is a plus

What it’s like to work with us:

Talent is our best asset!

We invest in people with passion and potential who understand U.S. News’ dedication to our consumers.

Entrepreneurial, mission-driven culture with core values of quality and integrity

Focus on fostering personal and professional growth

Competitive benefits including paid vacation time, medical, tuition reimbursement, and training

Collaborative Work Environment ~ Fun, diverse, inclusive and ambitious co-workers

Other Job Info:

Job Title: Early career data scientist / analyst / statistical geneticist
Job Description:
Are you an early career data scientist / analyst / statistical geneticist looking for work? Are you interested in working on the largest Parkinson’s disease genomics and clinical datasets available? Are you passionate about #OpenScience, democratizing research tools and increasing scientific inclusivity?

The COVID19 situation is difficult but we are hiring remote junior staff, targeting an immediate start date. Once the global situation calms in 2021, it is likely the researcher will be needed in the Washington DC area on site approximately two days per week.

Come work with us at NIH on data science projects as part of a diverse team of multidisciplinary scientists that will be helping support the next wave of brain disease initiatives.

We are looking for candidates early in their careers with basic programming skills that are willing to learn and apply new methods and techniques. This position includes general analysis workflows with standard packages (python3, dash, PLINK, HAIL, etc) with responsibilities ranging from data science and machine learning, to data visualization and dashboard builds, as well as some minor data and project management.

This position will include opportunities for on-the-job training, authorship on publications, some independent research, possible scientific conference travel and situational support for continuing education.

Scope of research: Supporting cloud based analysis and data sharing solutions for large genomics and clinical efforts in neurodegenerative disease research. This will focus on running and refining standard analysis, data management and data visualization workflows. Big picture goal is improving open science ecosystems.

Ideal candidate(s): Candidate(s) (under graduate to post-doctoral level) should have some training in bioinformatics and programming (python/R and bash, at least). A basic familiarity with computer clusters and cloud-based computing is ideal. Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to work well in teams are required. The incumbent will have a major role in assisting in manuscript preparation and bioinformatic training of other team members, providing technical assistance, and maintaining research continuity within the laboratory.

Additional info: Full time employment on annual contract (30+ hours per week, renewable). Flexible hours + telecommuting. Salary and benefits negotiable / competitive.

Interested candidates should provide the following documents: cover letter, CV and if possible contact info for up to three relevant references.

If interested email: info@datatecnica.com
